Initiated By: SECURITIES & EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Date Initiated Explanation: ON APRIL 21, 2005, JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. ("JPMC") WAS ADVISED BY THE SEC ENFORCEMENT STAFF THAT IT WAS CONSIDERING ASKING THE COMMISSION TO BRING A CIVIL INJUNCTIVE ACTION AGAINST BANK ONE AND OTHERS ARISING FROM THE COLLAPSE OF NATIONAL CENTURY FINANCIAL ENTERPRISES, INC. ("NCFE"). JPMC RECEIVED A WRITTEN "WELLS NOTICE" ON APRIL 25, 2005.
Allegations: JPMC ASSISTED IN VIOLATING SECTION 17(A)(3) OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933 IN ALLOWING NCFE'S PRINCIPALS IN EXECUTING THEIR INSTRUCTIONS TO MAKE LARGE CASH TRANSFERS THAT AIDED IN DISGUISING THE MIS-USE OF THEIR MONTH-END TRANSFERS.
Sanction Detail: THE ORDER FINDS THAT JPMC WAS A CAUSE OF NCFE'S VIOLATION OF SECTION 17(A)(3) OF THE SECURITIES ACT AND ORDERS JPMC TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $1,286,808.82 AND PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $711,335.76.
Summary: THE ORDER REQUIRES JPMC TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS AND ANY FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 17(A)(3) OF THE SECURITIES ACT, AND ORDERS JPMC TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $1,286,808.82 AND PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $711,335.76. JPMC CONSENTED TO THE ISSUANCE OF THE ORDER WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING ANY OF THE FINDINGS THEREIN.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: CIVIL PENALTY
Allegations: ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2013, THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC") ISSUED A CEASE AND DESIST ORDER ("ORDER") AGAINST JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. ("JMPC") RELATING TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES ARISING FROM THE 2012 LOSSES IN JPMC'S CHIEF INVESTMENT OFFICE ("CIO"). THE ORDER STATES THAT JPMC VIOLATED SECTIONS 13(A), 13(B)(2)(A), AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 ("EXCHANGE ACT") AND RULES 13A-11, 13A-13, AND 13A-15 THEREUNDER BECAUSE IT FAILED TO MAINTAIN EFFECTIVE INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING AS OF MARCH 31, 2012, AND DISCLOSURE CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES, AND FILED INACCURATE REPORTS WITH THE SEC.
Sanction Detail: THE ORDER REQUIRES THAT JPMC CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS AND ANY FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 13(A), 13(B)(2)(A), AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT AND RULES 13A-11, 13A-13, AND 13A-15 THEREUNDER. IN ADDITION, THE ORDER REQUIRES JPMC TO PAY A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF $200 MILLION, WHICH WAS PAID ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2013. AS PART OF THE SETTLEMENT, JPMC ACKNOWLEDGED THAT ITS CONDUCT VIOLATED THE FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS AND ADMITTED TO CERTAIN FACTS, SUCH AS BUT NOT LIMITED TO: THAT JPMC'S TRADERS MISMARKED THE SYNTHETIC CREDIT PORTFOLIO ("SCP") AS LOSSES MOUNTED AND AS A RESULT OF THESE MARKING PRACTICES, THE SCP TRADERS INTENTIONALLY UNDERSTATED MARK-TO-MARKET LOSSES IN THE SCP; JPMC'S EARNINGS RELEASE FOR THE QUARTER ENDING MARCH 31, 2012, INCLUDED THE UNDERSTATED LOSSES FOR THE SCP, AND JPMC SUBSEQUENTLY ISSUED A RESTATEMENT WHICH HAD THE EFFECT OF MOVING SCP LOSSES FROM THE SECOND QUARTER TO THE FIRST QUARTER OF 2012; AND JPMC HAD INEFFECTIVE INTERNAL ACCOUNTING CONTROLS AND DISCLOSURE CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES AS OF MARCH 31, 2012. JPMC HAS VOLUNTARILY UNDERTAKEN A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF REMEDIATION TO ADDRESS, AMONG OTHER THINGS, THE INTERNAL CONTROL DEFICIENCIES THAT ARE SUBJECT OF THE SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, SUCH AS, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SUBSTANTIALLY STRENGTHENING THE CIO VALUATION CONTROL GROUP FUNCTION WITHIN CIO TO ENSURE THAT PRICE VERIFICATION PROCEDURES ARE CONDUCTED WITH THE APPROPRIATE DEGREEOF INDEPENDENCE AND SUPERVISION.
Summary: JPMC CONSENTED TO THE ISSUANCE OF THE ORDER AND THE ORDER WAS ISSUED ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2013. THE ORDER MADE THE FINDINGS DESCRIBED ABOVE IN ITEM 7 AND JPMC ACKNOWLEDGED THAT IT VIOLATED THE FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS AND ADMITTED TO CERTAIN FACTS DESCRIBED ABOVE IN ITEM 12.

Initiated By: CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF CORPORATIONS
Other Sanctions: IN ADDITION TO THE AGREEMENT TO REPURCHASE CERTAIN AUCTION RATE SECURITIES ("ARS") SOLD TO ELIGIBLE INVESTORS PRIOR TO FEBRUARY 13, 2008, THE SETTLEMENT CALLS FOR THE REIMBURSEMENT OF ELIGIBLE INVESTORS WHO SOLD ARS BELOW PAR, REFUNDING OF CERTAIN LOAN EXPENSES INCURRED BY ELIGIBLE INVESTORS, SPECIAL ARBITRATION PROCEEDINGS CONCERNING CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WITH RESPECT TO ARS, REFUNDING CERTAIN REFINANCING FEES INCURRED BY MUNICIPAL ISSUERS OF ARS AND A CIVIL PENALTY.
Allegations: THE INVESTIGATION CONCERNED ALLEGED MISREPRESENTATIONS AND OMISSIONS IN CONNECTION WITH THE MARKETING, SALE AND DISTRIBUTION OF AUCTION RATE SECURITIES.
Other Sanctions Ordered: IN ADDITION TO THE AGREEMENT TO REPURCHASE CERTAIN AUCTION RATE SECURITIES ("ARS") SOLD TO ELIGIBLE INVESTORS PRIOR TO FEBRUARY 13, 2008, THE SETTLEMENT CALLS FOR THE REIMBURSEMENT OF ELIGIBLE INVESTORS WHO SOLD ARS BELOW PAR, REFUNDING OF CERTAIN LOAN EXPENSES INCURRED BY ELIGIBLE INVESTORS, SPECIAL ARBITRATION PROCEEDINGS CONCERNING CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WITH RESPECT TO ARS, REFUNDING CERTAIN REFINANCING FEES INCURRED BY MUNICIPAL ISSUERS OF ARS AND A CIVIL PENALTY.
Sanction Detail: THE FINE WAS PAID ON AUGUST 27, 2009. THE FINE REPRESENTS THE CALIFORNIA PORTION OF A TOTAL FINE OF $25 MILLION NEGOTIATED WITH THE NYAG AND THE STATE OF FLORIDA OFFICE OF FINANCIAL REGULATION ON BEHALF OF THE NASAA TASK FORCE. THE REMAINING AMOUNT WILL BE PAID SEPARATELY TO OTHER STATES. ALSO PAID WAS $15,000 TO NASAA AS REIMBURSEMENT FOR INVESTIGATIVE COSTS INCURRED BY NASAA.
Summary: THE ACTION RELATED TO ALLEGATIONS WITH RESPECT TO MISREPRESENTATIONS AND OMISSIONS IN CONNECTION WITH THE MARKETING, SALE AND DISTRIBUTION OF AUCTION RATE SECURITIES. AS DESCRIBED HEREIN, THE PRINCIPAL TERMS OF THE SETTLEMENT WERE NEGOTIATED WITH THE NYAG AND THE STATE OF FLORIDA OFFICE OF FINANCIAL REGULATION ON BEHALF OF THE NASAA TASK FORCE THAT CONTEMPLATES SEPARATE SIMILAR AGREEMENTS WITH OTHER STATES.

THE REMAINING AMOUNT WILL BE PAID SEPARATELY TO OTHER STATES. ALSO PAID WAS $15,000 TO NASAA AS REIMBURSEMENT FOR INVESTIGATIVE COSTS INCURRED BY NASAA.

Initiated By: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE
Other Sanctions: AGREEMENT
Case Number: IN THE MATTER OF JPMORGAN CHASE & CO.
Allegations: ON JULY 6, 2011, JPMORGAN CHASE & CO., INCLUDING ITS PREDECESSORS AND SUBSIDIARIES ("JPMC"), ENTERED INTO A NON-PROSECUTION AGREEMENT WITH THE ANTITRUST DIVISION OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE ("DOJ") IN WHICH JPMC ACCEPTS RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE CONDUCT OF CERTAIN FORMER EMPLOYEES ON JPMC'S NOW-CLOSED MUNICIPAL DERIVATIVES DESK, WHO BETWEEN 2001 AND 2006 ENTERED INTO UNLAWFUL AGREEMENTS TO MANIPULATE THE BIDDING PROCESS AND RIG BIDS ON CERTAIN RELEVANT MUNICIPAL CONTRACTS, AND MADE PAYMENTS AND ENGAGED IN OTHER ACTIVITIES IN CONNECTION WITH THESE AGREEMENTS, IN VIOLATION OF SECTION 1 OF THE SHERMAN ACT AND CERTAIN SECTIONS OF TITLE 18.
Other Sanctions Ordered: THE SETTLEMENT RESOLVED THE INVESTIGATIONS DESCRIBED ABOVE, SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS REGARDING ON-GOING COMPLIANCE AND TO CERTAIN NOTICE AND COOPERATION REQUIREMENTS.
Sanction Detail: JPMC AGREED TO CERTAIN NOTICE, DISCLOSURE, AND COOPERATION REQUIREMENTS. JPMC ALSO AGREED TO MAKE ALL REASONABLE EFFORTS TO PAY RESTITUTION TO ANY PERSON OR ENTITY INJURED AS A RESULT OF THE CONDUCT.
Summary: JPMC ENTERED INTO THE NON-PROSECUTION AGREEMENT WITH THE ANTITRUST DIVISION IN CONNECTION WITH AN INVESTIGATION OF THE BIDDING ON OR PROVISION OF CERTAIN RELEVANT MUNICIPAL CONTRACTS IN THE UNITED STATES. THE SETTLEMENT RESOLVED THE INVESTIGATIONS DESCRIBED ABOVE, SUBJECT TO CONDITIONS REGARDING ON-GOING COMPLIANCE AND TO CERTAIN NOTICE AND COOPERATION REQUIREMENTS. IN COORDINATION WITH THE DOJ SETTLEMENT, JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. AND CERTAIN OF ITS AFFILIATES ALSO ENTERED INTO SETTLEMENTS WITH OTHER AGENCIES TO RESOLVE CONCURRENT INVESTIGATIONS ARISING OUT OF THE SAME CONDUCT. THOSE SETTLEMENTS ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE U.S. SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION FILED A COMPLAINT FOR VIOLATIONS OF THE FEDERAL SECURTIES LAWS AND J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC SUBMITIED AN EXECUTED CONSENT TO THE ENTRY OF A FINAL JUDGMENT, WHICH THE DISTRICT COURT ENTERED ON JULY 8, 2011; JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A. ENTERED INTO A FORMAL AGREEMENT AND A CONSENT ORDER FOR A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY WITH THE OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CURRENCY; JPMORGAN CHASE & CO., J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC, AND JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A. ENTERED INTO A CLOSING AGREEMENT OF FINAL DETERMINATION OF TAX LIABILITY AND SPECIFIC MATTERS WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE; AND J.P. MORGAN CHASE & CO. ENTERED INTO WRITTEN AGREEMENTS WITH THE FEDERAL RESERVE BANK OF NEW YORK AND A GROUP OF STATES ATTORNEYS GENERAL.

Initiated By: INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE
Other Sanctions: AGREEMENT, $50 MILLION PAYMENT
Allegations: ON JULY 7, 2011, JPMORGAN CHASE & CO., J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC, AND JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A. (COLLECTIVELY, "JPMORGAN") ENTERED INTO A CLOSING AGREEMENT OF FINAL DETERMINATION OF TAX LIABILITY AND SPECIFIC MATTERS ("AGREEMENT") WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE IN CONNECTION WITH JPMORGAN'S ROLE IN PROVIDING OR BIDDING ON CERTAIN GUARANTEED INVESTMENT CONTRACTS, SWAPS AND OTHER CONTRACTS WITH CERTAIN ISSUERS OF MUNICIPAL BONDS OR WITH CERTAIN ENTITIES WHICH BORROWED THE PROCEEDS OF SUCH BONDS FROM THE ISSUER THEREOF OR OTHERWISE WERE THE BENEFICIARIES OF SUCH BONDS. THE AGREEMENT WAS ENTERED WITH JPMORGAN TO RESOLVE CERTAIN REGULATORY VIOLATIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE.
Other Sanctions Ordered: $50 MILLION PAYMENT.
Sanction Detail: JPMORGAN AGREED TO PAY $50 MILLION FOR CERTAIN REGULATORY VIOLATIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE COMMITTED IN CONNECTION WITH JPMORGAN'S ROLE IN PROVIDING OR BIDDING ON CERTAIN GUARANTEED INVESTMENT CONTRACTS, SWAPS AND OTHER CONTRACTS WITH THE ISSUERS OF CERTAIN MUNICIPAL BONDS OR WITH CERTAIN ENTITIES WHICH BORROWED THE PROCEEDS OF SUCH BONDS FROM THE ISSUER THEREOF OR OTHERWISE WERE THE BENEFICIARIES OF SUCH BONDS.
Summary: JPMORGAN ENTERED INTO THE AGREEMENT WITH THE IRS. THE SETTLEMENT RESOLVED THE INVESTIGATIONS DESCRIBED ABOVE AND RESULTED IN THE PAYMENT DESCRIBED ABOVE. WITH RESPECT TO COMPLIANCE BY THE ISSUERS WITH THE ARBITRAGE REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 148 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, UNDER THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT THE INVESTMENT AND DERIVATIVE CONTRACTS ASSOCIATED WITH A STATE OR LOCAL BOND ENTERED INTO WITH JPMORGAN DURING THE PERIOD 1997 THROUGH 2006 ARE DEEMED TO HAVE BEEN ENTERED INTO ON TERMS WHICH REPRESENT THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF SUCH CONTRACTS. IN COORDINATION WITH THE IRS SETTLEMENT, JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. AND CERTAIN OF ITS AFFILIATES ALSO ENTERED INTO SETTLEMENTS WITH OTHER AGENCIES TO RESOLVE CONCURRENT INVESTIGATIONS. THOSE SETTLEMENTS ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE U.S. SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION FILED A COMPLAINT FOR VIOLATIONS OF THE FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS AND J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC SUBMITTED AN EXECUTED CONSENT TO THE ENTRY OF A FINAL JUDGMENT, WHICH THE DISTRICT COURT ENTERED ON JULY 8, 2011; JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A. ENTERED INTO A FORMAL AGREEMENT AND A CONSENT ORDER FOR A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY WITH THE OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CURRENCY; AND JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. ENTERED INTO WRITTEN AGREEMENTS WITH THE FEDERAL RESERVE BANK OF NEW YORK, THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE, AND A GROUP OF STATE ATTORNEYS GENERALS.

THE FINE REPRESENTS THE TENNESSEE PORTION OF A TOTAL FINE OF $25 MILLION NEGOTIATED WITH THE NYAG AND THE STATE OF FLORIDA OFFICE OF FINANCIAL REGULATION ON BEHALF OF THE NASAA TASK FORCE. THE REMAINING AMOUNT WILL BE PAID SEPARATELY TO OTHER STATES. ALSO PAID WAS $15,000 TO NASAA AS REIMBURSEMENT FOR INVESTIGATIVE COSTS INCURRED BY NASAA.

Initiated By: BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM
Other Sanctions: REMEDIATION ACTIONS
Allegations: ON JANUARY 14, 2013, JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A., JPMORGAN BANK AND TRUST COMPANY, N.A. AND CHASE BANK USA, N.A. (TOGETHER, THE "BANKS") ENTERED INTO A CONSENT ORDER WITH THE OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CURRENCY ("OCC") RELATED TO THEIR OVERALL PROGRAM FOR BANK SECRECY ACT/ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING ("BSA/AML") COMPLIANCE (THE "OCC ORDER"). ON THE SAME DATE, JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. ("JPMC") ENTERED INTO A CONSENT ORDER WITH THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM ("FEDERAL RESERVE"; THE "FEDERAL RESERVE ORDER") RELATED TO BSA/AML REQUIREMENTS. THE FEDERAL RESERVE ORDER DOES NOT INCLUDE FINDINGS ON ANY ISSUES OF FACT OR LAW AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE AN ADMISSION BY JPMC OF ANY ALLEGATIONS MADE OR IMPLIED BY THE FEDERAL RESERVE IN CONNECTION WITH THE MATTER. HOWEVER, THE FEDERAL RESERVE ORDER DESCRIBES A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED INTO BY THE OCC AND THE BANKS DESIGNED TO REMEDY DEFICIENCIES (AS SET FORTH IN OCC CONSENT ORDER NO. AA-EC-13-04), WHICH THE BANKS HAVE NEITHER ADMITTED NOR DENIED, STATES THAT THE OCC IDENTIFIED DEFICIENCIES IN THE BANKS' BSA/AML COMPLIANCE PROGRAMS, AND THAT THE DEFICIENCIES INDICATED THAT JPMC'S FIRM-WIDE BSA/AML COMPLIANCE PROGRAM FAILED TO ENSURE THE BANKS' COMPLIANCE WITH CERTAIN OF THE BSA/AML REQUIREMENTS. THE OCC ORDER INCLUDES VARIOUS FINDINGS, WHICH THE BANKS NEITHER ADMITTED NOR DENIED.
Other Sanctions Ordered: REMEDIATION ACTIONS
Sanction Detail: THE FEDERAL RESERVE ORDER REQUIRES JPMC AND ITS INSTITUTION-AFFILIATED PARTIES TO CEASE AND DESIST AND TAKE AFFIRMATIVE ACTIONS AS FOLLOWS: (1) JPMC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHALL TAKE STEPS TO ENSURE THAT THE BANKS COMPLY WITH THE OCC ORDER, (2) JPMC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHALL SUBMIT A WRITTEN PLAN TO CONTINUE ONGOING ENHANCEMENTS TO THE BOARD'S OVERSIGHT OF JPMC'S FIRM-WIDE BSA/AML COMPLIANCE RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, (3) JPMC SHALL SUBMIT A WRITTEN PLAN TO IMPROVE THE FIRM-WIDE COMPLIANCE RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WITH REGARD TO BSA/AML REQUIREMENTS AND THE REGULATIONS ISSUED BY THE OFFICE OF FOREIGN ASSETS CONTROL OF THE U.S. TREASURY, (4) JPMC SHALL COMPLETE A REVIEW OF THE EFFECTIVENESS OF JPMC'S FIRM-WIDE BSA/AML COMPLIANCE PROGRAM AND PREPARE A WRITTEN REPORT OF FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS, (5) JPMC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS SHALL REVIEW THE REPORT AND SUBMIT A WRITTEN PLAN THAT INCLUDES A DESCRIPTION OF THE SPECIFIC ACTIONS, INCLUDING TIMELINES FOR COMPLETION, THAT JPMC WILL TAKE TO STRENGTHEN JPMC'S FIRM-WIDE BSA/AML PROGRAM; AND (6) JPMC'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR AN AUTHORIZED COMMITTEE THEREOF SHALL SUBMIT WITHIN 30 DAYS AFTER THE END OF EACH CALENDAR QUARTER FOLLOWING THE DATE OF THE ORDER WRITTEN PROGRESS REPORTS DETAILING THE FORM AND MANNER OF ALL ACTIONS TAKEN TO SECURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE FEDERAL RESERVE ORDER.
Summary: JPMC CONSENTED TO THE ISSUANCE OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE CONSENT ORDER, WITHOUT THE FEDERAL RESERVE CONSENT ORDER CONSTITUTING AN ADMISSION BY JPMC OR ANY OF ITS SUBSIDIARIES OF ANY ALLEGATION MADE OR IMPLIED BY THE FEDERAL RESERVE IN CONNECTION WITH THIS MATTER. THE FEDERAL RESERVE ORDER WAS ISSUED ON JANUARY 14, 2013, THE HIGHLIGHTS OF WHICH ARE DESCRIBED ABOVE IN ITEM 7.

Initiated By: BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM
Other Sanctions: REMEDIATION ACTIONS
Allegations: ON JANUARY 14, 2013, THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM ("FEDERAL RESERVE") ISSUED A CONSENT ORDER TO CEASE AND DESIST ("CONSENT ORDER") AGAINST JPMORGAN CHASE & CO. ("JPMC"). THE CONSENT ORDER STATES THAT THE FEDERAL RESERVE IDENTIFIED DEFICIENCIES IN THE RISK MANAGEMENT FUNCTION'S OVERSIGHT OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYNTHETIC CREDIT PORTFOLIO; THE MODEL GOVERNANCE FUNCTION'S OVERSIGHT OF THE MODEL VALIDATION PROCESSES RELATING TO THE CHIEF INVESTMENT OFFICE ("CIO"); THE FINANCE FUNCTION'S DEVELOPMENT OF APPROPRIATE INTERNAL FINANCIAL REPORTING FOR THE CIO; THE INTERNAL AUDIT FUNCTION'S ASSESSMENT OF THE CIO'S INTERNAL CONTROLS; AND SENIOR MANAGEMENT'S ELEVATION OF ISSUES TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE CONSENT ORDER MAKES NO FINDING ON ANY ISSUES OF FACT OR LAW AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE AN ADMISSION BY JPMC OF ANY ALLEGATIONS MADE OR IMPLIED BY THE FEDERAL RESERVE IN CONNECTION WITH THIS MATTER. THE CONSENT ORDER DESCRIBES A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED INTO BY THE OFFICE OF THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CURRENCY ("OCC") AND JPMORGAN CHASE BANK, N.A. (THE "BANK") DESIGNED TO REMEDY DEFICIENCIES, WHICH THE BANK HAS NEITHER ADMITTED OR DENIED, IDENTIFIED BY THE OCC IN THE BANK'S BOARD AND MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT, AS WELL AS BANK GOVERNANCE, RISK MANAGEMENT, MODEL RISK MANAGEMENT, VALUATION CONTROL, AND INTERNAL AUDIT PROGRAMS.
Other Sanctions Ordered: REMEDIATION ACTIONS
Sanction Detail: THE CONSENT ORDER REQUIRES JPMC AND ITS INSTITUTION-AFFILIATED PARTIES TO CEASE AND DESIST AND TAKE AFFIRMATIVE ACTION AS FOLLOWS: (1) TAKE STEPS TO ENSURE THE BANK COMPLIES WITH THE OCC ORDER; (2) SUBMIT A WRITTEN PLAN TO STRENGTHEN THE BOARD'S OVERSIGHT OF JPMC'S RISK MANAGEMENT, INTERNAL AUDIT, AND FINANCE FUNCTIONS; (3) SUBMIT WRITTEN PLANS TO CONTINUE ONGOING ENHANCEMENTS TO JPMC'S RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, FINANCE FUNCTIONS, AND FIRMWIDE INTERNAL AUDIT; AND (4) PERIODICALLY SUBMIT WRITTEN PROGRESS REPORTS DETAILING THE FORM AND MANNER OF ALL ACTIONS TAKEN TO SECURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONSENT ORDER. ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2013, THE FEDERAL RESERVE ISSUED AN ORDER OF ASSESSMENT OF A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY ISSUED UPON CONSENT PURSUANT TO THE FEDERAL DEPOSIT INSURANCE ACT, AS AMENDED, AGAINST JPMC (DOCKET NO.13-031-CMP-HC) ("PENALTY ORDER") REQUIRING JPMC TO PAY A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF $200 MILLION, WHICH WAS PAID ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2013.
Summary: JPMC CONSENTED TO THE ISSUANCE OF THE CONSENT ORDER, WITHOUT THE CONSENT ORDER CONSTITUTING AN ADMISSION BY JPMC OR ANY OF ITS SUBSIDIARIES OF ANY ALLEGATION MADE OR IMPLIED BY THE FEDERAL RESERVE IN CONNECTION WITH THE MATTER. THE CONSENT ORDER WAS ISSUED ON JANUARY 14, 2013, THE HIGHLIGHTS OF WHICH ARE DESCRIBED ABOVE IN ITEM 7. ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2013, THE FEDERAL RESERVE ISSUED THE PENALTY ORDER AGAINST JPMC RELATING TO THE CIRCUMSTANCES ARISING FROM THE 2012 LOSSES IN JPMC'S CHIEF INVESTMENT OFFICE ("CIO").

Initiated By: CHICAGO MERCANTILE EXCHANGE INC.
Other Sanctions: HCM INADVERTENTLY EXCEEDED A POSITION LIMIT AND PROMPTLY SELF-LIQUIDATED THE EXCESS CONTRACT POSITIONS UPON DISCOVERY. HCM WAS ORDERED TO PAY AN IMMATE.RIAL FINE AND PROFITS WERE DISGORGED.
Allegations: HCM INADVERTENTLY EXCEEDED A POSITION LIMIT BY APPROXIMATELY 2.3% IN A COMMODITY FUTURES  CONTRACT.

Summary: PURSUANT TO AN OFFER OF SETTLEMENT IN WHICH HIGHBRIDGE CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, LLC ("HCM")NEITHER ADMITTED NOR DENIED THE RULE VIOLATION UPON WHICH THE PENALTY IS BASED, A PANEL OF THE CME BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEE FOUND THAT WHILE TRADING IN A FINANCIAL FUTURES CONTRACT, HCM INADVERTENTLY EXCEEDED A POSITION LIMIT BY APPROXIMATELY 2.3%.

Initiated By: BAFIN, GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY
Allegations: AN ENTITY IS REQUIRED TO FILE A NOTIFICATION ("NOTIFICATION FILING") WHEN ITS SHAREHOLDINGS OF A SECURITY, WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMAN, REACH, EXCEED OR FALL BELOW PRESCRIBED LIMITS ("THRESHOLD LIMITS").  WHEN THE THRESHOLD LIMITS ARE REACHED, NOTIFICATION FILINGS ARE TO BE FILLED WITH THE GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY ("BAFIN") AND ISSUER OF THE SECURITY WITHIN A SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD.  WHILE BLACKROCK ("BLACKROCK, INC. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES") FILED THE NOTIFICATION FILINGS FOR CERTAIN SECURITIES, THE FILINGS WERE NOT COMPLETED WITHIN THE REQUIRED TIME PERIOD.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF FINE 167,503.50  EUROS
Summary: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 167,503.50 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $ 238,386 AS OF JUNE 18, 2012) FOR BLACKROCK BEING IN CONTRAVENTION OF THE REQUIREMENT TO FILE NOTIFICATION FILINGS WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME.  BLACKROCK HAS AGREED TO PAY THE FINE.

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN (FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN)
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A SWEDISH ISSUER.
Allegations: THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INC. HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, REPORTS THAT ITS COLLECTIVE OWNERSHIP OF SECURITIES IN THE SWEDISH ISSUER, ASSA ABLOY AB, CROSSED CERTAIN OWNERSHIP THRESHOLDS.
Sanction Detail: FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN IMPOSED A SPECIAL FEE OF 300,000 SEK (APPROXIMATELY $46,300 USD)
Summary: BLACKROCK, INC., PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON JANUARY 27, 2014

Initiated By: NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL ("AG")
Allegations: THE AG ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF CERTAIN ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW.
Other Sanctions Ordered: AGREEMENT OF DISCONTINUANCE
Sanction Detail: BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS.
Summary: ON JANUARY 8, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. ("BLACKROCK") ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE ("AOD") WITH THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE ("AG") TO SETTLE ALLEGATIONS BY THE AG THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW.  THE AGREEMENT DID NOT INVOLVE THE PAYMENT OF ANY FINE OR OTHER PENALTY.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS AND AGREED TO PAY THE AG $400,000 TOWARDS THE COST OF ITS INVESTIGATION

Initiated By: COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION (CFTC)
Allegations: FOR THE FISCAL YEARS ENDED 2002 AND 2004, RUSSELL INVESTMENTS IRELAND LIMITED AND RUSSELL INVESTMENTS CAYMAN LTD. FAILED TO FILE WITH THE NATIONAL FUTURES ASSOCIATION ANNUAL REPORTS FOR TWO COMMODITY POOLS IN A TIMELY MANNER, IN VIOLATION OF CFTC REGULATION.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: N/A
Sanction Detail: A MONETARY FINE IN THE AMOUNT OF $120,000 WAS LEVIED AGAINST RUSSELL INVESTMENTS IRELAND LIMITED AND RUSSELL INVESTMENTS CAYMAN LTD., JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY, BY THE CFTC AND HAS BEEN PAID.  NO PORTION OF THE PENALTY WAS WAIVED.  BOTH ENTITIES HAVE AGREED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM FAILURE TO TIMELY FILE ANNUAL REPORTS.
Summary: ORDER WAS NOT CONTESTED. RUSSELL INVESTMENTS IRELAND LIMITED AND RUSSELL INVESTMENTS CAYMAN LTD., JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY, REMITTED $120,000 TO THE CFTC.  MATTER CLOSED SEPTEMBER 27, 2007.

Initiated By: AUTORIT DES MARCHS FINANCIERS (AMF)
Other Sanctions: REPRIMAND
Allegations: INQUIRIES BY THE CONSEIL DES MARCHS FINANCIERS AND THE COMMISSION DES OPERATIONS DE BOURSE REGARDING THE CUSTODIAN FUNCTION OF NBP, THE ORGANIZATION OF THE NBP SAFEKEEPING AND ADMINISTRATION OF SECURITIES ACTIVITY, AND WEAKNESSES IN INTERNAL CONTROLS OF A SUBSIDIARY.
Other Sanctions Ordered: REPRIMAND.
Sanction Detail: THE AMF PRONOUNCED A PENALTY OF 1,100,000 EUROS (WHICH CONVERTS TO $1,338,700, USING THE AVERAGE DAILY EXCHANGE RATE FROM JUNE 24, 2004) AGAINST NBP AND CERTAIN SUBSIDIARIES.  THE PENALTY IMPOSED WAS 500,000 EUROS AGAINST NBP (FORMERLY NATIXIS CAPITAL), 300,000 EUROS AGAINST NBP, AND 300,000 EUROS AGAINST NATEXIS BLEICHRODER SA.
Summary: THE AMF PRONOUNCED THE FOLLOWING PUBLIC SANCTIONS AGAINST NBP AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES: A REPRIMAND AND PENALTY OF 500,000 EUROS AGAINST NBP (FORMERLY NATIXIS CAPITAL), A REPRIMAND AND A PENALTY OF 300,000 AGAINST NBP, AND A REPRIMAND AND A PENALTY OF 300,000 EUROS AGAINST NATEXIS BLEICHROEDER SA.  SUBSEQUENTLY, NBP REORGANIZED ITS CUSTODIAN CONTROL DEPARTMENT IN RELIANCE ON THE ADVICE OF OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS AND SET UP A STEERING COMMITTEE TO MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF REMEDIAL WORK PLANS.  NBP HAD ALREADY DECIDED AT THE TIME THE SANCTIONS WERE PRONOUNCED TO DISSOLVE THE SUBSIDIARY WITH RESPECT TO WHICH INTERNAL CONTROLS WERE INVESTIGATED.

Initiated By: SEC
Other Sanctions: OTHER SANCTIONS INCLUDE (A) A PROHIBITION FROM SERVING AS AN EMPLOYEE, OFFICER, DIRECTOR, ADVISORY BOARD MEMBER, BROKER, DEALER, ADVISOR, DEPOSITOR OR UNDERWRITER FOR ANY REGISTERED INVESTMENT COMPANY, AFFILIATE, DEPOSITOR OR UNDERWRITER, (B) A DISGORGEMENT OF LOSSES AVOIDED, (C) PAYMENT OF A CIVIL PENALTY AND INTEREST, AND (D) A CEASE AND DESIST FROM FURTHER VIOLATIONS OF  SECTION 17(A)  OF THE SECURITIES ACT AND SECTION 10(B) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER.
Employing Firm: LACUNA LLC AND LACUNA HEDGE GP, LLLP
Allegations: THE SEC ALLEGED THAT MR. O'LEARY ENGAGED IN INSIDER TRADING RELATING TO THE SECURITIES OF TOWERSTREAM CORPORATION IN ADVANCE OF THE ANNOUNCEMENT AFTER THE MARKET CLOSE ON JANUARY 30, 2013 OF ITS INTENT TO OFFER FOR PURCHASE SHARES OF ITS PREVIOUSLY REGISTERED COMMON STOCK IN AN UNDERWRITTEN PUBLIC OFFERING.
Other Sanctions Ordered: OTHER SANCTIONS INCLUDE A PROHIBITION FROM SERVING AS AN EMPLOYEE, OFFICER, DIRECTOR, ADVISORY BOARD MEMBER, BROKER, DEALER, ADVISOR, DEPOSITOR OR UNDERWRITER FOR ANY REGISTERED INVESTMENT COMPANY, AFFILIATE, DEPOSITOR OR UNDERWRITER.
Sanction Detail: THE SUSPENSION PERIOD IS:  ONE YEAR THE TOTAL AMOUNT LEVIED WAS: $14,003, WHICH CONSISTS OF $6,845 IN DISGORGEMENT, $6,845 IN CIVIL PENALTIES AND $313 IN INTEREST
Summary: IN ANTICIPATION OF A PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION AND CEASE-AND-DESIST PROCEEDING BEING INITIATED BY THE SEC, MR. O'LEARY SUBMITTED AN OFFER OF SETTLEMENT CONSISTENT WITH SANCTIONS OUTLINED HEREIN, WHICH WAS ACCEPTED BY THE SEC. IN DETERMINING TO ACCEPT THE OFFER, THE SEC CONSIDERED COOPERATION AFFORDED THE COMMISSION STAFF BY MR. O'LEARY.

Allegations: THE FINANCIAL MARKET AUTHORITY (AMF) FINED SOCIETE GENERALE 500,000 EUROS FOR (I) BREACHING ARTICLE 332-6 OF THE GENERAL REGULATION OF AMF BY FAILING TO PROVE THE EXISTENCE OF CLIENT INSTRUCTIONS FOR A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF SUBSCRIPTIONS TO THE PUBLIC OFFERING BY THE EDF GROUP AND (II) BREACHING ARTICLES 321-24. 321-42, 321-43, 321-47, AND 321-76 OF THE GENERAL REGULATION OF THE AMF BY REDUCING THE SIZE OF CERTAIN SUBSCRIPTION ORDERS AND FAILING TO HAVE IN PLACE SUFFICIENT SUPERVISORY TOOLS IN THIS AREA.

Allegations: DURING THE PERIOD FROM NOVEMBER 2007 TO FEBRUARY 2010, SOCIETE GENERALE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM (I) DID NOT SUBMIT TRADE REPORTING DATA FOR REPORTABLE TRANSACTIONS OR SUBMITTED INACCURATE DATA IN SUCH REPORTS IN 18.8 MILLION OF ITS 23.5 MILLION REPORTABLE TRANSACTIONS, AND (II) DID NOT RETAIN AND HAVE AVAILABLE SUCH TRADE REPORTING DATA, IN VIOLATION OF FSA RULES.

Initiated By: THE FRENCH COMPETITION AUTHORITY (AUTORITE DE LA CONCURRENCE).
Other Sanctions: FINE
Allegations: FOLLOWING AN INVESTIGATION, THE FRENCH COMPETITION AUTHORITY (AUTORITE DE LA CONCURRENCE) ISSUED A DECISION FINDING THAT (11) MAJOR FRENCH RETAIL BANKS, INCLUDING SOCIETE GENERALE AND ITS SUBSIDIARY, CREDIT DU NORD, HAD ENGAGED IN ANTICOMPETITIVE ACTIVITY IN CONNECTION WITH FEES ASSOCIATED WITH ELECTRONIC CHECK PROCESSING SERVICES AND CERTAIN OTHER FEES FOR RELATED SERVICES IN FRANCE. THE FRENCH COMPETITION AUTHORITY FOUND THAT A FEE OF 0.043 EUROS PER CHECK WAS UNJUSTIFIED AND AN INFRINGEMENT OF COMPETITION RULES IN FRANCE AND THAT CERTAIN OTHER FEES WERE NOT PROPORTIONATE TO COSTS INCURRED BY THE BANKS. THE PRIMARY PROCESSING FEES WERE CHARGED BETWEEN JANUARY 2002 AND JULY 2007. THE GROUP OF ELEVEN BANKS WAS FINED A TOTAL OF 384.92 MILLION EUROS. SOCIETE GENERALE WAS FINED 53.47 MILLION EUROS AND CREDIT DU NORD WAS FINED 6.98 MILLION EUROS.
Appeal Details: COURT OF APPEALS OF PARIS (COUR D'APPEL DE PARIS)
Other Sanctions Ordered: FINE OF 53.47 MILLION EUROS FOR SOCIETE GENERALE AND 6.98 MILLION EUROS FOR CREDIT DU NORD
Sanction Detail: SOCIETE GENERALE WAS FINED 53.47 MILLION EUROS. CREDIT DU NORD WAS FINED 6.98 MILLION EUROS.
Summary: THE MATTER IS CURRENTLY BEING APPEALED.

Initiated By: COMMISSION BANCAIRE (FRANCE)
Other Sanctions: FINE
Date Initiated Explanation: HEARING ON 6/20/2008, DECISION ANNOUNCED ON 7/03/2008
Allegations: FOLLOWING THE ANNOUNCEMENT ON JANUARY 24, 2008 BY SOCIETE GENERALE OF SIGNIFICANT LOSSES FROM CERTAIN UNAUTHORIZED TRADING ACTIVITY IN ITS PARIS OFFICE, THE FRENCH COMMISSION BANCAIRE REPRIMANDED AND FINED SOCIETE GENERALE EURO 4 MILLION FOR BREACHING REGULATORY PROVISIONS CONCERNING INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES (FRENCH BANKING AND REGULATORY COMMITTEE REGULATION NO 97-02). THE REFERENCED REGULATORY ACTION RELATES SOLELY TO THE ULTIMATE PARENT COMPANY OF THE REGISTRANT IN PARIS, FRANCE AND HAS NO BEARING ON OR RELATIONSHIP TO THE BUSINESS OF THE REGISTRANT.
Other Sanctions Ordered: THE AMOUNT OF THE FINE WAS EURO 4 MILLION. THE $6 MILLION REFLECTED ABOVE IS THE APPROXIMATE CURRENT VALUE OF THE FINE IN THE UNITED STATES.
Sanction Detail: THE FRENCH COMMISSION BANCAIRE REPRIMANDED AND FINED SOCIETE GENERALE EURO 4 MILLION.
Summary: SEE EXPLANATION ABOVE.

Initiated By: AUTORITE DES MARCHES FINANCIERS (AMF)
Date Initiated Explanation: ON OR ABOUT 11/22/2011
Allegations: FOLLOWING AN INVESTIGATION, THE AMF ISSUED A DECISION FINDING THAT, IN CONNECTION WITH SELLING ASSETS BETWEEN JUNE 2007 AND JUNE 2008, SG ASSET MANAGEMENT ("SGAM") FAILED TO EXECUTE OR EFFECTIVELY FULFIL CERTAIN RISK CONTROL AND COMPLIANCE FUNCTIONS. FOLLOWING AN INVESTIGATION, THE AMF ISSUED A DECISION FINDING THAT SG ASSET MANAGAMENT ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS ("SGAM AI") FAILED TO EXECUTE OR EFFECTIVELY FULFIL CERTAIN RISK CONTROL AND COMPLIANCE FUNCTIONS IN CONNECTION WITH OVERTAKING RATIOS AND CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WITH AFFILIATE SGAM BANK. IN ADDITION, IN CONNECTION WITH ONE INVESTEMENT FUND THE AMF FOUND THAT SGAM AI PUTS ITS INTERETS BEFORE THOSE OF THE INVESTORS IN THE FUND BY MAINTAINING THE FUND'S INVESTMENT IN SGAM AI CREDIT COURT TERME.
Resolution Date Explanation: ON OR ABOUT 11/22/2011
Other Sanctions Ordered: SGAM WAS FINED 1 MILLION EUROS. SGAM AI WAS FINED 1.5 MILLION EUROS. TOTAL FINE OF BOTH ENTITIES WAS FOR 2.5 MILLION EUROS = $3,280,000 US DOLLARS.
Sanction Detail: SGAM WAS FINED 1 MILLION EUROS. SGAM AI WAS FINED 1.5 MILLION EUROS. TOTAL FINE OF BOTH ENTITIES WAS FOR 2.5 MILLION EUROS = $3,280,000 US DOLLARS.
Summary: SGAM WAS FINED 1 MILLION EUROS. SGAM AI WAS FINED 1.5 MILLION EUROS. TOTAL FINE OF BOTH ENTITIES WAS FOR 2.5 MILLION EUROS = $3,280,000 US DOLLARS.

Initiated By: THE SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION (SFC) (HONG KONG)
Other Sanctions: REIMBURSEMENT OF CUSTOMERS; ENGAGEMENT OF INDEPENDENT REVIEWER
Date Initiated Explanation: ON OR AROUND 7/17/2012
Other Product: OVER-THE-COUNTER BONDS, OPTIONS AND STRUCTURED NOTES.
Allegations: THE SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION ("SFC") ALLEGED THAT, IN OVER 3,000 TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN APRIL 2003 AND JANUARY 2006, SOCIETE GENERALE, HONG KONG BRANCH FAILED TO ADEQUATELY DISCLOSE TO CUSTOMERS OF ITS WEALTH MANAGEMENT UNIT CERTAIN FEES AND CHARGES IN SECONDARY MARKET TRANSACTIONS OF OVER-THE-COUNTER BONDS, OPTIONS AND STRUCTURED NOTES ("OTC TRANSACTIONS").
Resolution Date Explanation: ON OR AROUND
Other Sanctions Ordered: ENGAGEMENT OF INDEPENDENT REVIEWER
Sanction Detail: WITHOUT ADMITTING LIABILITY, SOCIETE GENERALE AGREED TO ACCEPT A REPRIMAND FROM THE SFC AND TO REIMBURSE AFFECTED CUSTOMERS THE FULL VALUE OF THE ALLEGEDLY UNDISCLOSED FEES, TOGETHER WITH INTEREST. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO ASSESS THE AMOUNT TO BE PAID TO ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS. THE TOTAL AMOUNT TO BE REIMBURSED IS EXPECTED TO BE IN EXCESS OF $11 MILLION USD. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO REVIEW THE CONTROLS, SYSTEMS AN PROCEDURES OF ITS WEALTH MANAGEMENT UNIT IN HONG KONG IN RELATION TO ITS CURRENT PRACTICE IN CHARGING CUSTOMERS IN OTC TRANSACTIONS TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE COMPLIANT WITH LEGAL AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS.
Summary: WITHOUT ADMITTING LIABILITY, SOCIETE GENERALE AGREED TO ACCEPT A REPRIMAND FROM THE SFC AND TO REIMBURSE AFFECTED CUSTOMERS THE FULL VALUE OF THE ALLEGEDLY UNDISCLOSED FEES, TOGETHER WITH INTEREST. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO ASSESS THE AMOUNT TO BE PAID TO ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS. THE TOTAL AMOUNT TO BE REIMBURSED IS EXPECTED TO BE IN EXCESS OF $11 MILLION USD. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO REVIEW THE CONTROLS, SYSTEMS AN PROCEDURES OF ITS WEALTH MANAGEMENT UNIT IN HONG KONG IN RELATION TO ITS CURRENT PRACTICE IN CHARGING CUSTOMERS IN OTC TRANSACTIONS TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE COMPLIANT WITH LEGAL AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS.

Initiated By: EUROPEAN COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: FINE OF EUR 445.9 MILLION
Date Initiated Explanation: DATE ORIGINAL DECISION WAS ISSUED BY EUROPEAN COMMISSION
Allegations: INTERNAL INVESTIGATION CARRIED OUT BY THE BANK FOR NEARLY TWO YEARS IN CLOSE COOPERATION WITH THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION UNCOVERED SOME ATTEMPTS TO MANIPULATE THE EURIBOR RATE, DATING BACK TO A LIMITED TIME PERIOD BETWEEN MARCH 2006 AND MAY 2008. HOWEVER, THE EVENTS OCCURRED FOR THE MOST PART OVER ONE YEAR, BETWEEN MARCH 2006 AND MARCH 2007. ON 4 DECEMBER 2013, THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION ISSUED A DECISION FURTHER TO ITS INVESTIGATION INTO THE EURIBOR RATE, THAT PROVIDES FOR THE PAYMENT BY SOCIETE GENERALE OF AN AMOUNT OF EUR 445.9 MILLION IN RELATION TO EVENTS THAT OCCURRED BETWEEN MARCH 2006 AND MAY 2008. SOCIETE GENERALE HAS FILED AN APPEAL WITH THE EU GENERAL COURT REGARDING THE METHOD USED TO DETERMINE THE VALUE OF THE SALES THAT SERVED AS A BASIS FOR THE CALCULATION OF THE FINE.
Appeal Details: APPEAL FILED WITH THE EU GENERAL COURT ON FEBRUARY 14, 2014, CASE T-98/14, SOCIT GNRALE V COMMISSION
Resolution Date Explanation: DATE OF DECISION: DECEMBER 4, 2013; DATE OF APPEAL: FEBRUARY 14, 2014
Other Sanctions Ordered: EUR 445.9 MILLION, ON APPEAL CHALLENGING METHOD USED TO DETERMINE FINE.
Sanction Detail: EUR 445.9 MILLION, ON APPEAL CHALLENGING METHOD USED TO DETERMINE FINE.
Summary: PLEASE SEE EXPLANATION ABOVE. THE MATTER IS ON APPEAL

Allegations: MR. MOTSCHWILLER AND OTHERS WERE ALLEGED TO HAVE VIOLATED ARTICLE III, SECTIONS 1, 4 AND 18 OF THE RULES OF FAIR PRACTICE.  ALLEGED TO HAVE SOLD SHARES OF NEW ISSUE, TRADED AT A PREMIUM IN IMMEDIATE AFTERMARKET TO RESTRICTED ACCOUNTS.
Sanction Detail: FINE AND DISGORGEMENT TOTALING $13,250. $2,000 FINE WAS LEVIED AND DISGORGEMENT OF $11,250. FINE FULLY PAID AS OF OCTOBER 31, 1991.
Summary: MR. MOTSCHWILLER OFFERED A SETTLEMENT AMOUNT OF $13,250, WHICH THE NASD ACCEPTED. RESULTED IN CENSURE AND FINE AND DISGORGEMENT TOTALING $13,250. $2,000 FINE WAS LEVIED AND DISGORGEMENT OF $11,250. FINE FULLY PAID AS OF OCTOBER 31, 1991.

Initiated By: ONTARIO SECURITIES COMMISSION, CANADA (OSC)
Other Sanctions: SUBMISSION TO A REVIEW OF HSBC BANK CANADA'S COMPLIANCE PRACTICES AND PROCEDURES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF REFERENCE IN THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT, AND PAY THE COSTS OF THE OSC'S INVESTIGATION IN THE AMOUNT OF CAD75,000.
Allegations: BETWEEN JULY 25 AND AUGUST 13, 2007, HSBC BANK CANADA ENGAGED IN CONDUCT CONTRARY TO THE PUBLIC INTEREST BY FAILING TO ADEQUATELY RESPOND TO EMERGING ISSUES IN THE THIRD PARTY ASSET BACKED COMMERCIAL PAPER (ABCP) MARKET INSOFAR AS IT CONTINUED TO SELL THIRD PARTY ABCP WITHOUT ENGAGING COMPLIANCE AND OTHER APPROPRIATE PROCESSES FOR THE ASSESSMENT OF SUCH INFORMATION AND CONCERNS.
Other Sanctions Ordered: SUBMISSION TO A REVIEW OF HSBC BANK CANADA'S COMPLIANCE PRACTICES AND PROCEDURES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF REFERENCE IN THE SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT, AND PAY THE COSTS OF THE OSC'S INVESTIGATION IN THE AMOUNT OF CAD75,000.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT MADE DECEMBER 22, 2009.  NO PORTION OF THE SETTLEMENT AMOUNT WAS WAIVED.
Summary: ALL TERMS OF SETTLEMENT FULFILLED

Initiated By: ALBERTA INSURANCE COUNCIL (AIC)
Allegations: THE ALBERTA INSURANCE ACT AND REGULATIONS REQUIRE THAT HSBC BANK CANADA ANNUALLY APPLY FOR A CERTIFICATE FROM THE ALBERTA INSURANCE COUNCIL (AIC) IN ORDER TO SELL INSURANCE PRODUCTS IN THE PROVINCE.  AS A RESULT OF INCOMPLETE SUBMISSIONS AND DELAYS, THE BANK'S APPLICATION FOR THE 2004/2005 CERTIFICATE WAS SUBMITTED LATE.  STAFF CONTINUED TO SELL INSURANCE PRODUCTS UNDER AN EXPIRED CERTIFICATE.   THE AIC FOUND THE BANK TO BE IN VIOLATION OF THE REQUIREMENT TO HAVE A VALID CERTIFICATE IN ORDER TO CONDUCT SALES OF INSURANCE PRODUCTS IN ALBERTA.
Other Sanctions Ordered: NONE
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF C$500.00 SUBMITTED 31 MAY 2005.  NO PORTION OF THE SETTLEMENT AMOUNT WAS WAIVED.
Summary: ALL TERMS OF SETTLEMENT FULFILLED

Initiated By: THE OFFICE OF THE SUPERINTENDENT OF FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS (OSFI)
Allegations: HSBC BANK CANADA FILED A QUARTERLY OSFI RETURN E2 MORTGAGE LOANS REPORT BY ITS DEADLINE OF NOVEMBER 14, 2011.  TWO ERRORS WERE IDENTIFIED LATER, AND THE CORRECTED REPORT WAS REFILED ON NOVEMBER 30, 2011.  OSFI ISSUED A NOTICE OF VIOLATION UNDER ITS "LATE AND ERRONEOUS FILING PENALTY FRAMEWORK" ON JANUARY 30, 2012 PROPOSING A PER DIEM PENALTY OF CAD500 FOR THE 16 DAYS BETWEEN THE FILING OF THE ORIGINAL AND CORRECTED REPORTS.  HSBC BANK CANADA DID NOT OBJECT TO THE PROPOSED PENALTY AND PAID CAD8000 ON APRIL 13, 2012.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF CAD8,000 MADE ON APRIL 13, 2012.  NO PORTION OF THIS AMOUNT WAS WAIVED.
Summary: ALL TERMS OF NOTICE OF VIOLATION FULFILLED.

Initiated By: US FEDERAL DEPOSIT INSURANCE CORPORATION
Other Sanctions: N/A
Allegations: ON 21 APRIL 2011, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC WAS SERVED WITH A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION BY THE EC SEEKING GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE HSBC GROUP AS WELL AS INFORMATION AND DOCUMENTS RELATING TO COMMUNICATIONS BETWEEN HSBC HOLDINGS PLC AND OTHER PANEL BANKS / CASH BROKERS BETWEEN 2007 AND 2010 REGARDING THE SETTING OF YEN LIBOR AND TRADING POSITIONS WHICH MAY BE AFFECTED BY IT. VARIOUS REGULATORS AND COMPETITION AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES AROUND THE WORLD INCLUDING IN THE UK, THE US, CANADA, THE EU, SWITZERLAND AND ASIA, ARE CONDUCTING INVESTIGATIONS AND REVIEWS RELATED TO CERTAIN PAST SUBMISSIONS MADE BY PANEL BANKS AND THE PROCESSES FOR MAKING SUBMISSIONS IN CONNECTION WITH THE SETTING OF LONDON INTERBANK OFFERED RATES ('LIBOR'), EUROPEAN INTERBANK OFFERED RATES ('EURIBOR') AND OTHER BENCHMARK INTEREST AND FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES.   SEVERAL OF THESE PANEL BANKS HAVE REACHED SETTLEMENTS WITH VARIOUS REGULATORY AUTHORITIES. AS CERTAIN HSBC ENTITIES ARE MEMBERS OF SUCH PANELS, HSBC AND/OR ITS SUBSIDIARIES HAVE BEEN THE SUBJECT OF REGULATORY DEMANDS FOR INFORMATION AND ARE COOPERATING WITH THOSE INVESTIGATIONS AND REVIEWS. BASED ON THE FACTS CURRENTLY KNOWN, THERE IS A HIGH DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY AS TO THE RESOLUTION OF THESE REGULATORY INVESTIGATIONS AND REVIEWS, INCLUDING THE TIMING. THE POTENTIAL IMPACT AND SIZE OF ANY FINES OR PENALTIES THAT COULD BE IMPOSED ON HSBC CANNOT BE MEASURED RELIABLY.  IN ADDITION, HSBC AND OTHER PANEL BANKS HAVE BEEN NAMED AS DEFENDANTS IN PRIVATE LAWSUITS FILED IN THE US WITH RESPECT TO THE SETTING OF LIBOR, INCLUDING PUTATIVE CLASS ACTION LAWSUITS WHICH HAVE BEEN CONSOLIDATED BEFORE THE US DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK. THE COMPLAINTS IN THOSE ACTIONS ASSERT CLAIMS AGAINST HSBC AND OTHER PANEL BANKS UNDER VARIOUS US LAWS INCLUDING US ANTITRUST LAWS, THE US COMMODITIES EXCHANGE ACT, AND STATE LAW. BASED ON THE FACTS CURRENTLY KNOWN, IT IS NOT PRACTICABLE AT THIS TIME FOR HSBC TO PREDICT THE RESOLUTION OF THESE PRIVATE LAWSUITS, INCLUDING THE TIMING AND POTENTIAL IMPACT ON HSBC. ON 02 SEPTEMBER 2014 THE LAWSUIT WAS DISMISSED BY A US DISTRICT JUDGE.
Resolution Date Explanation: ON 02 SEPTEMBER 2014 THE LAWSUIT WAS DISMISSED BY A US DISTRICT JUDGE.
Other Sanctions Ordered: N/A
Sanction Detail: N/A

Initiated By: OCC; FRB; OFAC; US DEPT OF JUSTICE; UK FCA; US ATTY'S OFF FOR THE EASTERN DIST OF NY & NORTHERN DIST OF WV; NY COUNTY DIST ATTY.
Other Sanctions: MONETARY/FINE
Employing Firm: HSBC BANK USA, N.A., HSBC NORTH AMERICA HOLDINGS AND HSBC HOLDINGS PLC.
Allegations: US REGULATORY AUTHORITIES' INVESTIGATIONS REGARDING INADEQUATE COMPLIANCE WITH ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING AND SANCTIONS LAWS
Other Sanctions Ordered: ON DEC 11, 2012, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ANNOUNCED THAT HSBC BANK USA, NA ("HBUS"), HAD IN RELATION TO INVESTIGATIONS REGARDING INADEQUATE COMPLIANCE WITH ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING AND SANCTIONS LAWS ENTERED INTO (I) AN AGREEMENT & CONSENT ORDERS WITH THE OCC; (II) A CONSENT & ASSESSMENT WITH THE US DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY'S FINANCIAL CRIMES ENFORCEMENT NETWORK; (III) A DEFERRED PROSECUTION AGREEMENT ("DPA") AMONG HBUS, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC, THE US DEPT OF JUSTICE, THE US ATTY'S OFFICE FOR THE EASTERN DIST OF NY AND THE US ATTY'S OFFICE FOR THE NORTHERN DIST OF WEST VIRGINIA; AND (IV) HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ENTERED INTO A DPA WITH THE DIST ATTY OF THE COUNTY OF NY. HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ALSO CONSENTED TO A CEASE & DESIST ORDER AND ALONG WITH HSBC NORTH AMERICA HOLDINGS CONSENTED TO A MONETARY PENALTY ORDER WITH THE FRB. IN ADDITION, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ENTERED INTO AN AGREEMENT WITH OFAC REGARDING HISTORICAL TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING PARTIES SUBJECT TO OFAC SANCTIONS AND AN UNDERTAKING WITH THE UK FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY ("FCA"), TO COMPLY WITH CERTAIN FORWARD-LOOKING AML- AND SANCTIONS-RELATED OBLIGATIONS. HSBC BANK USA, NA MAY NOT DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ACQUIRE CONTROL OF, OR HOLD AN INTEREST IN, ANY NEW FINANCIAL SUBSIDIARY, NOR COMMENCE A NEW ACTIVITY IN ITS EXISTING FINANCIAL SUBSIDIARY, UNLESS IT RECEIVES PRIOR APPROVAL FROM THE OCC. ON 1 JULY 2013, THE US DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF NY APPROVED THE US DPA AND RETAINED AUTHORITY TO OVERSEE IMPLEMENTATION OF THAT AGREEMENT. UNDER THE AGREEMENTS WITH THE DOJ, FCA AND FRB, AN INDEPENDENT MONITOR (WHO IS, FOR FCA PURPOSES, A 'SKILLED PERSON' UNDER SECTION 166 OF THE FINANCIAL SERVICES AND MARKETS ACT) WILL EVALUATE AND REGULARLY ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF HSBC'S AML AND SANCTIONS COMPLIANCE FUNCTION AND HSBC'S PROGRESS IN IMPLEMENTING ITS REMEDIAL OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENTS. THE MONITORSHIP, WHICH BEGAN ON JULY 22, 2013, IS PROCEEDING AS ANTICIPATED.

Summary: ON DECEMBER 11, 2012, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ANNOUNCED THAT HSBC BANK USA, NA, HAD IN RELATION TO INVESTIGATIONS REGARDING INADEQUATE COMPLIANCE WITH ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING AND SANCTIONS LAWS ENTERED INTO (I) AN AGREEMENT AND CONSENT ORDERS WITH THE OCC; (II) A CONSENT AND ASSESSMENT WITH THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF THE TREASURY'S FINANCIAL CRIMES ENFORCEMENT NETWORK; (III) A DEFERRED PROSECUTION AGREEMENT ("DPA") AMONG HSBC BANK USA, NA, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC, THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE (THE "DOJ"), THE UNITED STATES ATTORNEY'S OFFICE FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK AND THE UNITED STATES ATTORNEY'S OFFICE FOR THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF WEST VIRGINIA; AND (IV) HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ENTERED IN TO A DPA WITH THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY OF THE COUNTY OF NEW YORK. HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ALSO CONSENTED TO A CEASE AND DESIST ORDER AND ALONG WITH HSBC NORTH AMERICA HOLDINGS CONSENTED TO A MONETARY PENALTY ORDER WITH THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM ("FRB"). IN ADDITION, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC ENTERED INTO AN AGREEMENT WITH THE OFFICE OF FOREIGN ASSETS CONTROL ("OFAC") REGARDING HISTORICAL TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING PARTIES SUBJECT TO OFAC SANCTIONS AND AN UNDERTAKING WITH THE UK FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY ("FCA"), TO COMPLY WITH CERTAIN FORWARD-LOOKING AML- AND SANCTIONS-RELATED OBLIGATIONS. UNDER THESE AGREEMENTS, HSBC HOLDINGS PLC AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES HAVE MADE PAYMENTS TOTALING $1.921 BILLION.  ON JULY 1, 2013, THE US DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK APPROVED THE US DPA AND RETAINED AUTHORITY TO OVERSEE IMPLEMENTATION OF THAT AGREEMENT. UNDER THE AGREEMENTS WITH THE DOJ, FCA AND FRB, AN INDEPENDENT MONITOR WILL EVALUATE AND REGULARLY ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF HSBC'S AML AND SANCTIONS COMPLIANCE FUNCTION AND HSBC'S PROGRESS IN IMPLEMENTING ITS REMEDIAL OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENTS. THE MONITORSHIP, WHICH BEGAN ON JULY 22, 2013, IS PROCEEDING AS ANTICIPATED.

Initiated By: CVM - COMISSAO DE VALORES MOBILIARIOS
Date Initiated Explanation: THE MATTER WAS PENDING
Allegations: CVM WAS INVESTIGATING THE POSSIBLE LIABILITY OF ONE OF OUR ADVISORY AFFILIATES FOR THE NONCOMPLIANCE WITH ART. 155, 1, ACT 6404/76 C/C ART. 13, CAPUT, 358/02
Sanction Detail: NEITHER EXPLORA NOR ITS ADVISORY AFFILIATES PAID ANY SETTLEMENT, FINES OR PENALTIES TO THE CVM.
Summary: CVM WAS INVESTIGATING THE POSSIBLE LIABILITY OF ONE OF OUR ADVISORY AFFILIATES FOR THE NONCOMPLIANCE WITH ART. 155, 1, ACT 6404/76 C/C ART. 13, CAPUT, 358/02.  THE CVM BOARD UNANIMOUSLY ABSOLVED THE ADVISORY AFFILIATE OF ANY WRONGDOING. AS A CONSEQUENCE, THERE ARE NO OUTSTANDING PENDING CVM ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDINGS. MOREOVER, NEITHER EXPLORA NOR THE ADVISORY AFFILIATE PAID ANY SETTLEMENT, FINES OR PENALTIES TO THE CVM.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Allegations: MMA CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, LLC ("MMA") IS THE ULTIMATE PARENT COMPANY (APPROXIMATELY 96% OWNERSHIP) OF THE ADVISOR.  MMA IS A PUBLIC COMPANY REGISTERED WITH THE SEC UNDER THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 (THE "ACT").  DURING THE "GLOBAL FINANCIAL CRISIS" MMA WAS UNABLE TO FULLY COMPLY WITH ITS FILING OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE ACT.
Other Sanctions Ordered: DEREGISTRATION OF COMMON SHARES.
Sanction Detail: THE SEC ISSUED AN ORDER REVOKING REGISTRATION OF MMA'S COMMON SHARES ("DEREGISTRATION ORDER") EFFECTIVE SEPTEMBER 30, 2013.
Summary: MMA CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, LLC ("MMA") IS THE ULTIMATE PARENT COMPANY (APPROXIMATELY 96% OWNERSHIP) OF THE ADVISOR.  MMA IS A PUBLIC COMPANY REGISTERED WITH THE SEC UNDER THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 (THE "ACT").  DURING THE "GLOBAL FINANCIAL CRISIS" MMA WAS UNABLE TO FULLY COMPLY WITH ITS FILING OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE ACT.  ON SEPTEMBER 27, 2013, MMA ENTERED INTO A SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT WITH THE SEC INTENDED TO RESOLVE CLAIMS RELATING TO THESE FILING DEFICIENCIES. PURSUANT TO THE SETTLEMENT, THE SEC ISSUED AN ORDER REVOKING REGISTRATION OF MMA'S COMMON SHARES ("DEREGISTRATION ORDER") EFFECTIVE SEPTEMBER 30, 2013. ONCE THE DEREGISTRATION ORDER WAS EFFECTIVE, MMA WAS ELIGIBLE TO RE-REGISTER ITS COMMON SHARES WITH THE SEC. ACCORDINGLY MMA FILED A REGISTRATION STATEMENT ON FORM 8-A ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2013 TO RE-REGISTER ITS COMMON SHARES UNDER SECTION 12(G) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT, WHICH WAS EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY UPON FILING. THEREFORE, AS OF THE FILING OF MMA'S FORM 8-A, MMA'S COMMON SHARES WERE ONCE AGAIN REGISTERED UNDER THE EXCHANGE ACT WITH THE SEC. AS A RESULT OF THE DEREGISTRATION, AND SUBSEQUENT RE-REGISTRATION, OF MMA'S COMMON SHARES, MMA HAS RESOLVED THE HISTORICAL FILING DEFICIENCIES.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: BAR, INJUNCTION, SUSPENSION AND REIMBURSEMENT
Allegations: ON DECEMBER 18, 2012, THE SEC FILED A COMPLAINT AGAINST ERIC ASHMAN ("ASHMAN") IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK.  SEE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION V. ERIC ASHMAN, NO. 12 CIV. 9189 (JGK).  THE SEC'S COMPLAINT ALLEGED, AMONG OTHER THINGS, THAT ASHMAN AIDED AND ABETTED A FRAUD RESULTING IN THE STREET FILING MATERIALLY FALSE AND MISLEADING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN THE COMPANY'S ANNUAL REPORT ON FORM 10-K FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2008, AND IN THE COMPANY'S QUARTERLY REPORTS ON FORM 10-Q FOR THE FIRST THREE FISCAL QUARTERS OF FISCAL YEAR 2008.  THE SEC'S COMPLAINT ALSO ALLEGED THAT ASHMAN ENGAGED IN A NUMBER OF IMPROPER ACCOUNTING PRACTICES THAT MATERIALLY INCREASED THESTREET'S OPERATING INCOME, OR DECREASED ITS OPERATING LOSS, IN A DEPARTURE FROM GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES.  THE SEC'S COMPLAINT ALSO ALLEGED THAT ASHMAN MADE A FALSE STATEMENT REGARDING REVENUE GROWTH AT A SUBSIDIARY OF THE STREET WHEN HE KNEW OR RECKLESSLY DISREGARDED THAT SUCH REVENUE ONLY INCREASED AS A RESULT OF IMPROPER ACCOUNTING IMPROPRIETIES.  THE SEC'S COMPLAINT ALSO ALLEGED THAT ASHMAN FAILED TO DEVISE OR MAINTAIN A SYSTEM OF ADEQUATE INTERNAL ACCOUNTING CONTROLS AT THESTREET.  ON DECEMBER 21, 2012, THE COURT ENTERED A FINAL JUDGMENT UPON CONSENT, WITH ASHMAN NEITHER ADMITTING NOR DENYING THE COMPLAINT'S ALLEGATIONS.  ON THE BASIS OF THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT AGAINST ASHMAN, THE SEC COMMENCED THE REGULATORY ACTION PURSUANT TO SEC RULE OF PRACTICE 102(E)(3)(1).
Sanction Detail: ON DECEMBER 21, 2012, A FINAL JUDGMENT WAS ENTERED AGAINST ASHMAN PERMANENTLY ENJOINING HIM FROM VIOLATING, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, SECTIONS 10(B) AND 13(B)(5) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, AS AMENDED (THE "EXCHANGE ACT") AND RULES 10B-5, 13A-14 AND 13B2-1 THEREUNDER; AND FROM AIDING AND ABETTING VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 13(A), 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT AND RULES 12B-20, 13A-1 AND 13A-13 THEREUNDER, IN THE CIVIL ACTION ENTITLED SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION V. ERIC ASHMAN, CIVIL ACTION NUMBER 12-CV-9189 (JGK), IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK.  ASHMAN WAS ALSO ORDERED TO PAY A $125,000 CIVIL MONEY PENALTY, ORDERED TO REIMBURSE THESTREET $34,149 PURSUANT TO SECTION 304 OF THE SARBANES OXLEY ACT OF 2002, AND PROHIBITED FOR THREE YEARS FROM ACTING AS AN OFFICER OR DIRECTOR OF ANY ISSUER THAT HAS A CLASS OF SECURITIES REGISTERED PURSUANT TO SECTION 12 OF THE EXCHANGE ACT OR THAT IS REQUIRED TO FILE REPORTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 15(D) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT.  ASHMAN CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF THIS JUDGMENT WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS OF THE SEC'S COMPLAINT.  ASHMAN PAID THE $125,000 CIVIL MONEY PENALTY ON JANUARY 3, 2013 AND REIMBURSED THESTREET IN THE AMOUNT OF  $34,149 ON THE SAME DATE.  ON JANUARY 11, 2013, ON THE BASIS OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT IN THE FEDERAL COURT ACTION, THE SEC ISSUED AN ORDER SUSPENDING ASHMAN FROM APPEARING OR PRACTICING BEFORE THE SEC AS AN ACCOUNTANT PURSUANT TO SEC RULE OF PRACTICE 102(E)(3)(I); PROVIDED THAT ASHMAN MAY REQUEST THAT THE SEC CONSIDER HIS REINSTATEMENT AFTER JANUARY 11, 2016.
Summary: ON DECEMBER 21, 2012, A FINAL JUDGMENT WAS ENTERED AGAINST ASHMAN PERMANENTLY ENJOINING HIM FROM VIOLATING, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, SECTIONS 10(B) AND 13(B)(5) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, AS AMENDED (THE "EXCHANGE ACT") AND RULES 10B-5, 13A-14 AND 13B2-1 THEREUNDER; AND FROM AIDING AND ABETTING VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 13(A), 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT AND RULES 12B-20, 13A-1 AND 13A-13 THEREUNDER, IN THE CIVIL ACTION ENTITLED SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION V. ERIC ASHMAN, CIVIL ACTION NUMBER 12-CV-9189 (JGK), IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK.  ASHMAN WAS ALSO ORDERED TO PAY A $125,000 CIVIL MONEY PENALTY, ORDERED TO REIMBURSE THESTREET $34,149 PURSUANT TO SECTION 304 OF THE SARBANES OXLEY ACT OF 2002, AND PROHIBITED FOR THREE YEARS FROM ACTING AS AN OFFICER OR DIRECTOR OF ANY ISSUER THAT HAS A CLASS OF SECURITIES REGISTERED PURSUANT TO SECTION 12 OF THE EXCHANGE ACT OR THAT IS REQUIRED TO FILE REPORTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 15(D) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT.  ASHMAN CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF THIS JUDGMENT WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS OF THE SEC'S COMPLAINT.  ON JANUARY 11, 2013, ON THE BASIS OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT IN THE FEDERAL COURT ACTION, THE SEC ISSUED AN ORDER SUSPENDING ASHMAN FROM APPEARING OR PRACTICING BEFORE THE SEC AS AN ACCOUNTANT PURSUANT TO SEC RULE OF PRACTICE 102(E)(3)(I); PROVIDED THAT ASHMAN MAY REQUEST THAT THE SEC CONSIDER HIS REINSTATEMENT AFTER JANUARY 11, 2016.

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA' E LA BROSA (CONSOB)
Other Sanctions: CONSOB IMPOSED ADMINISTRATIVE PECUNIARY FINES AGAINST MR. ANGELO AND THE FIRM
Allegations: MR. ANGELO AS THE CHAIRMAN OF YORKVILLE ADVISORS, LLC, THE INVESTMENT MANAGER TO YA GLOBAL INVESTMENTS, L.P. (THE INVESTOR) AND THE FIRM WERE FOUND AND FINED JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY  LIABLE FOR THE (I) BREACH OF THE OBLIGATION TO LAUNCH A PUBLIC TENDER OFFER IN THREE DIFFERENT INSTANCES (PURSUANT TO ART. 106, PAR. 1 AND ART. 109, PAR 1 OF CONSOLIDATED LAW ON FINANCE) AND (II) THE BREACH OF THE BAN TO VOTE IN THE SHAREHOLDERS' MEETING SINCE THE PUBLIC TENDER OFFER HAD NOT BEEN LAUNCHED PRIOR TO THE SHAREHOLDERS' MEETING (PURSUANT TO ART 110, AR. 1 OF CONSOLIDATED LAW OF FINANCE).
Other Sanctions Ordered: MR. ANGELO AND THE FIRM WERE JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY FINED 120,000 (EUROS).
Sanction Detail: AT THE END OF THE SANCTIONARY PROCEEDING, CONSOB IMPOSED AN ADMINISTRATIVE PECUNIARY FINE AGAINST MR. ANGELO FOR A TOTAL AMOUNT OF 120,000 (EUROS) AND THAT MR. ANGELO AND THE  FIRM WERE JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY HELD LIABLE FOR THE PAYMENT OF SUCH FINE WHICH WAS PAID ON MAY 3, 2012. THE BREAK DOWN OF THE FINE IS AS FOLLOWS: (I) 30,000 (EUROS) FOR EACH OF THE THREE INFRINGEMENTS OF THE COMBINED PROVISIONS OF ARTS. 106, SECTION 1 AND 109, SECTION 1 OF THE CONSOLIDATED LAW ON FINANCE FOR A TOTAL AMOUNT OF 90,000 (EUROS) & (II) 30,000 (EUROS) FOR INFRINGEMENT OF ART. 110, SECTION 1 OF THE CONSOLIDATED LAW ON FINANCE.
Summary: THE CONSOB RESOLUTION IMPOSING THE FINES HAS BEEN PAID ON MAY 3, 2012 AND AN APPEAL BY MR. ANGELO AND THE FIRM FOR ITS ANNULMENT BEFORE THE REGIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE TRIBUNAL OF LAZIO WAS FILED ON MAY 10, 2012.  ON MARCH 6, 2015 THE MILAN COURT OF APPEALS REJECTED THE APPEAL.

Initiated By: MONETARY AUTHORITY OF SINGAPORE
Allegations: THE MONETARY AUTHORITY OF SINGAPORE ("MAS") ISSUED A LETTER OF REPRIMAND TO SANSAR CAPITAL ASIA PTE. LTD. FOR LATE LODGEMENTS OF FORM 25 (NOW REPEALED) OF THE SECURITIES AND FUTURES (LICENSING AND CONDUCT OF BUSINESS) REGULATIONS AND FORM 23 OF THE FINANCIAL ADVISERS REGULATIONS AFTER THE END OF ITS FINANCIAL YEAR. THE FORMS REQUIRED THE REPORTING OF THE FIRM'S ASSETS UNDER MANAGEMENT AND THE NUMBER OF QUALIFIED INVESTORS OR ACCREDITED INVESTORS ON WHOSE BEHALF THE FIRM WAS ACTING.  THE FORMS WERE REQUIRED TO BE FILED WITH MAS WITHIN 14 DAYS OF THE END OF THE FIRM'S FISCAL YEAR.

Sanction Detail: A LETTER OF REPRIMAND FOR THE FIRM'S TECHNICAL VIOLATION

Initiated By: FAIR POLITICAL PRACTICES COMMISSION
Date Initiated Explanation: THIS IS THE DATE OF THE MEETING IN WHICH THE DECISION TO UPHOLD THE LATE CONTRIBUTION VIOLATION WAS HELD.  THE PENTALTY WAS THEREAFTER.
Allegations: LATE POLITICAL CONTRIBUTION(S) NOT TIMELY REPORTED UNDER CALIFORNIA POLITICAL REFORM ACT
Sanction Detail: NONE
Summary: ON NOVEMBER 14, 2007, THE CALIFORNIA FAIR POLITICAL PRACTICES COMMISSION ADOPTED MR. JAFFE'S STIPULATION OF VIOLATION AND MONETARY PENALTY.

Initiated By: HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION
Allegations: THE HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION ALLEGED THAT MR. RIGAS DID NOT TIMELY REPORT TO THE COMMISSION AND THE ISSUER, AS REQUIRED BY GREEK LAW, THAT HIS HOLDING OF THE COMMON SHARES OF SCIENS INTERNATIONAL INVESTMENTS & HOLDINGS S.A. (THE "COMPANY"), HAD INCREASED BY MORE THAN 3%.  MR. RIGAS' OWNERSHIP IN THE COMPANY (THEN PUBLIC, BUT SINCE DELISTED FROM THE ATHENS STOCK EXCHANGE) INCREASED FROM 59.07% TO 66.64% ON APRIL 4, 2012 THROUGH AN OVER-THE-COUNTER PURCHASE NEGOTIATED WITH ANOTHER SHAREHOLDER OF THE COMPANY.  MR. RIGAS HAD THREE TRADING DAYS TO MAKE THE RELEVANT NOTIFICATIONS AND, ACCORDING TO THE ALLEGATION, HE ONLY SATISFIED HIS NOTICE OBLIGATIONS ON APRIL 26, 2012.  HE THEREFORE WAS DEFICIENT IN HIS NOTICE OBLIGATIONS FOR 13 DAYS.
Sanction Detail: THE SOLE SANCTION WAS A FINE LEVIED AGAINST MR. RIGAS IN THE AMOUNT OF EUR 6000.
Summary: THE HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION FOUND THAT MR. RIGAS HAD VIOLATED THE RELEVANT TIMELY NOTICE OBLIGATIONS TO BOTH THE COMMISSION AND THE ISSUER.  MR. RIGAS WAS FINED A TOTAL OF EUR6000 FOR SUCH VIOLATIONS.  IN ADDITION, THE COMMISSION FOUND: 1.  THERE WAS NO DISRUPTION ON THE ORDERLY OPERATION OF THE MARKET. 2.  THE CHANGE IN PERCENTAGE WAS RELATIVELY SMALL. 3.  THE POSITION IN THE COMPANY HELD BY MR. RIGAS PRIOR TO THE NOTICE VIOLATION WAS ALREADY VERY HIGH (59.07%). 4.  THERE WAS NO CHANGE OF CONTROL IN THE COMPANY AS A RESULT OF THE INCREASE IN MR. RIGAS' HOLDINGS. 5.  MR. RIGAS COOPERATED WITH THE COMMISSION DURING THE INVESTIGATION.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION ("SFC")
Other Sanctions: PUBLIC REPRIMAND
Allegations: THE STATEMENT OF DISCIPLINARY ACTION FOLLOWS AN SFC INVESTIGATION INTO THE FAILURE OF DEUTSCHE BANK AG ("DBAG") TO DISCLOSE TO THE STOCK EXCHANGE OF HONG KONG ("SEHK") THE CHANGES TO ITS PERCENTAGE HOLDINGS IN THE ISSUED SHARE CAPITAL OF UP ENERGY DEVELOPMENT GROUP ON OCCASIONS IN 2011 (AS REQUIRED BY SECTIONS 310(1), 311, 313(1), 315, 324 AND 325(1)(A) OF THE SECURITIES AND FUTURES ORDINANCE (CAP 571)). THREE OF THESE OCCASIONS INVOLVED TRADING ACTIVITY BY DBAG; THE REMAINDER INVOLVED INCREASES TO THE LISTED COMPANY'S TOTAL ISSUED SHARE CAPITAL. THE SFC FOUND THAT DBAG FAILED TO IMPLEMENT ADEQUATE INTERNAL CONTROLS TO ENSURE ITS POSITIONS IN HONG KONG LISTED COMPANIES WERE PROPERLY MONITORED AND DISCLOSED TO SEHK IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE DISCLOSURE OF INTERESTS REQUIREMENTS.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: NOTE: THE ABOVE MONETARY FINE WAS HK$1.6 MILLION. US DOLLAR EQUIVALENT WAS $206,359.  PUBLIC REPRIMAND
Sanction Detail: WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, DBAG PAID A FINE OF HK$1.6 MILLION. THE FINE WAS PAID ON OR ABOUT 22 MAY 2014.
Summary: WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, DBAG PAID A FINE OF HK$1.6 MILLION. THE FINE WAS PAID ON OR ABOUT 22 MAY 2014.

Allegations: FINMA ALLEGED DBAG FILED LATE DISCLOSURES ON SHAREHOLDINGS IN ADECCO SA ON MARCH 26, MARCH 30, AND APRIL 13, 2010, AND LATE DISCLOSURE OF SHAREHOLDINGS IN PEACH PROPERTY GROUP ON NOVEMBER 25, 2010, IN VIOLATION OF ART. 20 OF STOCK EXCHANGE ACT.
Sanction Detail: NOTE: THE ABOVE MONETARY FINE IS IN SWISS FRANCS.

Initiated By: COMISION NACIONAL DEL MERCADO ("CNMV")
Allegations: THE CNMV ALLEGED DB LONDON ENGAGED IN A BREACH OF ITS OBLIGATION NOT TO CARRY OUT MARKET SOUNDING OR WALL CROSSING ACTIVITIES UNTIL THE CLOSE OF THE MADRID MARKET AND APPROVAL OF A SHORT PROSPECTUS FOR AN EQUITY PLACEMENT (BLOCK TRADE) EXECUTED IN SHARES OF SPANISH COMPANY EBRO PULEVA ON FEBRUARY 26, 2004.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: NOTE RE AMOUNT: AMOUNT IN EUROS (1,000,000 EUROS)
Sanction Detail: SUSPENDED FROM ACCELERATED BOOK BUILT DEALS IN SPANISH SECURITIES FOR A PERIOD OF THREE MONTHS FROM 19 DECEMBER 2006 THROUGH 19 MARCH 2007.
Summary: ON DECEMBER 19, 2006, DB LONDON RECEIVED NOTICE THAT THE CNMV RECEIVED APPROVAL TO SANCTION DB LONDON IN RESPECT OF AN EQUITY PLACEMENT (BLOCK TRADE) EXECUTED IN SHARES OF SPANISH COMPANY EBRO PULEVA IN FEBRUARY 2004. THE CNMV ALLEGED THAT PURSUANT TO PROSPECTUS DESCRIBING THE PLACEMENT, DB LONDON IMPOSED UPON ITSELF AN OBLIGATION NOT TO CARRY OUT ANY MARKET SOUNDING OR WALL CROSSING ACTIVITIES PRIOR TO THE CLOSE OF THE MADRID MARKET AND APPROVAL OF THE SHORT PROSPECTUS BY THE CNMV ON THE DATE OF THE TRANSACTION. THE CNMV ARGUED THAT DB LONDON BREACHED THIS OBLIGATION BY APPROACHING THREE INVESTORS TO DETERMINE MARKET INTEREST PRIOR TO THE MARKET CLOSE.

Initiated By: AUTORITE DES MARCHES FINANCIERS ("AMF")
Allegations: THE AMF ALLEGED CERTAIN ABUSES ARISING OUT OF THE CONVERTIBLE BOND OFFER FOR FRENCH TELECOMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT MARKER ALCATEL WHICH TOOK PLACE IN DECEMBER 2002. THE ALLEGATIONS CENTERED ON WHETHER HEDGE FUNDS ACTED ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION COMMUNICATED BY DB LONDON BEFORE THE ISSUANCE OF THE BONDS WAS PUBLICLY ANNOUNCED, DURING ITS MARKET SOUNDING ACTIVITIES. THE AMF CONCLUDED THAT DB HAD NO CULPABILITY IN RELATION TO ALLEGED INSIDER DEALING ACTIVITIES, BUT ALLEGED PROCEDURAL, RECORD KEEPING OMISSION BY DB, IN RELATION TO THE RECORDS IT MAINTAINED OF MARKET SOUNDINGS.
Other Sanctions Ordered: PLEASE NOTE THE ABOVE AMOUNT IS IN EUROS.
Sanction Detail: THE AMF IMPOSED A MONETARY SACTION OF 300,000 EUROS, WHICH HAS BEEN PAID IN FULL.
Summary: ON DECEMBER 22, 2006, THE AMF NOTIFIED DB LONDON THAT IT WOULD BE SANCTIONED FOR TECHNICAL AND PROCEDURAL VIOLATIONS IN CONNECTION WITH A CONVERTIBLE BOND OFFERING BY ALCATEL, DB LEAD MANAGED THE TRANSACTION. THERE WAS NO CASE TO ANSWER FOR INSIDER TRADING. DB LONDON CONDUCTED MARKET SOUNDINGS WITH SEVERAL HEDGE FUNDS AHEAD OF THE OFFERING IN DECEMBER 2002. DB LONDON WAS ABLE TO PRODUCE DOCUMENTATION SUFFICIENT TO ATTEST THAT IT WAS ENGAGED IN MARKET SOUNDING WHICH IS PERMITTED UNDER AMF RULES. HOWEVER, SINCE THE TIMES THE TELEPHONE CONTACTS WITH THE HEDGE FUNDS WERE MADE WERE NOT EVIDENCED IN THE DOCUMENTATION AND THE NAMES OF CERTAIN THIRD PARTIES WERE MISSING FROM THE FIRM'S RECORDS, AMF FOUND THAT DB LONDON ACTED CONTRARY TO FRENCH MARKET SOUNDING REGULATIONS. AMF IMPOSED A MONETARY SANCTION OF 300,000 EUROS.

Initiated By: CHICAGO BOARD OF TRADE (CME GROUP)
Allegations: ON JULY 24, 2014, A CHICAGO BOARD OF TRADE BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEE ACCEPTED A $60,000.00 FINE FROM DEUTSCHE BANK AG (DBAG) IN CONNECTION WITH ALLEGATIONS THAT DBAG VIOLATED CBOT RULE 562 (POSITION LIMIT VIOLATION). SPECIFICALLY, IT WAS ALLEGED THAT ON DECEMBER 12, 2013, DBAG HELD INTRADAY LONG POSITION OF 8,402 MARCH 2014 SOYBEAN OIL FUTURES CONTRACTS, WHICH EXCEEDED THE SINGLE MONTH SPECULATIVE POSITION LIMIT OF 8,000 CONTRACTS BY 42 CONTRACTS, OR BY .53%. PRIOR TO THE CLOSE ON 12/12/13, DBAG SOLD 10 CONTRACTS TO BRING ITSELF INTO COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE LIMIT. DBAG NEITHER ADMITTED NOR DENIED THE RULE VIOLATIONS UPON WHICH THE FINE IS BASED.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Sanction Detail: DBAG WAS ORDERED TO PAY A FINE OF $60,000.00. THE FINE WAS PAID ON AUGUST 5, 2014.
Summary: WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, DBAG AGREED TO PAY THE FINE OF $60,000.00 WHICH WAS PAID ON AUGUST 5, 2014.

Allegations: NYMEX ALLEGED THAT DBAG VIOLATED NYMEX RULE 562 (POSITION LIMIT VIOLATIONS). IN THAT ON JUNE 23, 2011, DEUTSCHE BANK HELD A POSITION OF 5,761.25 SHORT JULY 2011 HENRY HUB NATURAL GAS LOOKALIKE LAST DAY FINANCIAL FUTURES ("JUL11 NATGAS") CONTRACTS, WHICH WAS 1,261.25 CONTRACTS OR 28.0% OVER ITS EXCHANGE APPROVED EXPIRATION MONTH HEDGE EXEMPTION LEVEL OF 4,500 CONTRACTS IN JUL11 NATGAS. FURTHERMORE, ON JUNE 24, 2011, DEUTSCHE BANK INCREASED ITS JUL11 NATGAS POSITION TO 6,011.25 SHORT JUL11 NATGAS CONTRACTS OR 33.6% OVER ITS EXCHANGE APPROVED EXPIRATION MONTH HEDGE EXEMPTION LEVEL.

Initiated By: U.S. SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: DISGORGEMENT; CIVIL MONEY PENALTY.
Case Number: SEC ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING FILE NO. 3-15132; EXCHANGE ACT RELEASE NO. 68448.
Allegations: 1) BETWEEN 2001 AND 2008, MANAGERS OF AN INDONESIAN JOINT VENTURE MAJORITY-OWNED BY ALLIANZ SE MADE IMPROPER PAYMENTS TO EMPLOYEES OF STATE-OWNED ENTITIES IN INDONESIA; 2) THESE PAYMENTS WERE NOT ACCURATELY REFLECTED IN ALLIANZ SE'S BOOKS AND RECORDS; 3) ALLIANZ SE FAILED TO MAINTAIN A SYSTEM OF INTERNAL CONTROLS REASONABLY DESIGNED TO DETECT AND PREVENT THESE PAYMENTS; 4) AS A RESULT OF THE FOREGOING, ALLIANZ SE VIOLATED SECTIONS 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: 1) ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF A CEASE AND DESIST ORDER WHICH PROHIBITS FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934; 2) ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $5,315,649 PLUS PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $1,765,125 (TOTAL $7,080,774); 3) AS REFERENCED IN SECTION 12.A. OF THIS DRP, ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF $5,315,649.
Sanction Detail: ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $5,315,649, PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $1,765,125, AND A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF $5,315,649 (TOTAL PAYMENT OF $12,396,423).  THE PAYMENT WAS WIRED TO THE SEC ON DECEMBER 20, 2012.
Summary: ON DECEMBER 17, 2012, THE SEC ANNOUNCED THAT IT HAD REACHED A SETTLEMENT WITH ALLIANZ SE TO RESOLVE THE SEC'S INVESTIGATION OF ALLEGED MISCONDUCT AT AN INDONESIAN JOINT VENTURE MAJORITY-OWNED BY ALLIANZ SE.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE SEC'S ALLEGATIONS, ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM FURTHER VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, AND TO PAY APPROXIMATELY $12.4 MILLION IN DISGORGEMENT, PREJUDGMENT INTEREST, AND CIVIL PENALTY.  ALLIANZ SE COOPERATED WITH THE SEC DURING THE COURSE OF ITS INVESTIGATION. FURTHERMORE, FOLLOWING AN INDEPENDENT INTERNAL INVESTIGATION CONDUCTED BY ALLIANZ SE WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF EXTERNAL LEGAL COUNSEL, ALLIANZ SE MODIFIED ITS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO MITIGATE FCPA RISKS.  FOR EXAMPLE, ALLIANZ SE RECENTLY IMPLEMENTED A GROUP-WIDE ANTI-CORRUPTION PROGRAM.

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA ("CONSOB")
Allegations: BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED ("BIMUK") ON BEHALF OF THE BLACKROCK GROUP OF COMPANIES MADE AN INCORRECT LARGE  SHAREHOLDER THRESHOLD FILING TO CONSOB IN DECEMBER 2011 REGARDING ITS HOLDINGS IN UNICREDIT S.P.A., ON BEHALF OF CLIENTS.  BLACKROCK DETECTED THIS ERROR, SELF-REPORTED IT TO CONSOB AND INFORMED THE MARKET OF THIS MISTAKE BACK IN JANUARY 2012.

Summary: ON APRIL 29, 2014, CONSOB FINED BIMUK 150,000 EURO (APPROXIMATELY $205,826 USD)ON THE BASIS OF NEGLIGENT MARKET MANIPULATION ARISING FROM ITS INCORRECT LARGE SHAREHOLDER REPORT IN DECEMBER 2011.

Initiated By: HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: 3,000 EUROS
Date Initiated Explanation: THE DECISION OF THE REGULATOR WAS FIRST FORWARDED TO BLACKROCK IN MARCH 2010
Allegations: IN 2006 MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT LTD. DID NOT TIMELY FILE A REQUIRED DISCLOSURE WITH THE HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION REGARDING ITS PERCENTAGE OF TOTAL VOTING RIGHTS IN A CERTAIN GREEK-BASED COMPANY CHANGING FROM 5.01% TO 4.98% THE CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO THIS MATTER OCCURRED PRIOR TO BLACKROCK ACQUIRING MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENTS MANAGEMENT LTD.
Other Sanctions Ordered: PAYMENT OF FINE IN EUROS.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF 3,000 EUROS.
Summary: VIOLATION CHARGE INCURRED DUE TO LATE DISCLOSURE NOTIFICATION.

Initiated By: UNITED KINGDOM - FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY (FSA)
Allegations: BETWEEN OCTOBER 1, 2006 AND MARCH 31, 2010, BIMUK FAILED TO PUT TRUST LETTERS IN PLACE IN RELATION TO SOME OF THE MONEY MARKET DEPOSITS IT PLACED WITH THIRD PARTY BANKS.  THE ERROR OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF SYSTEMS CHANGES THAT FOLLOWED BLACKROCK GROUP'S ACQUISITION OF BIMUK, WHICH HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN KNOWN AS MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENT MANAGERS LIMITED.  THESE CHANGES RENDERED BIMUK'S PROCEDURES FOR SETTING UP TRUST LETTERS INNEFFECTIVE.
Sanction Detail: THE FSA HAS FINED BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED 9,533,100 POUNDS STERLING (APPROXIMATELY $15,322,551)
Summary: IN DETERMINING THE FINE THE FSA TOOK INTO ACCOUNT THAT THE MISCONDUCT WAS NOT DELIBERATE, AND THAT BIMUK SELF-REPORTED THE ISSUE TO THE FSA AND HAS SINCE REMEDIED THE SITUATION AND PUT IN PLACE ROBUST SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS RELATIVE TO THE PROCESS OF TRUST LETTERS FOR MONEY MARKET DEPOSITS PLACED WITH THIRD PARTY BANKS RELATING TO CLIENT MONEY PROTECTION. NO CLIENTS SUFFERED ANY LOSSES AS A RESULT OF THIS ERROR.  THE FINE HAS BEEN PAID TO THE FSA.

Initiated By: BAFIN, GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY
Allegations: AN ENTITY IS REQUIRED TO FILE A NOTIFICATION ("NOTIFICATION FILING") WHEN ITS SHAREHOLDINGS OF A SECURITY, WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMAN, REACH, EXCEED OR FALL BELOW PRESCRIBED LIMITS ("THRESHOLD LIMITS").  WHEN THE THRESHOLD LIMITS ARE REACHED, NOTIFICATION FILINGS ARE TO BE FILLED WITH THE GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY ("BAFIN") AND ISSUER OF THE SECURITY WITHIN A SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD.  WHILE BLACKROCK ("BLACKROCK, INC. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES") FILED THE NOTIFICATION FILINGS FOR CERTAIN SECURITIES, THE FILINGS WERE NOT COMPLETED WITHIN THE REQUIRED TIME PERIOD.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF FINE 167,503.50 EUROS
Summary: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 167,503.50 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $ 238,386 AS OF JUNE 18, 2012) FOR BLACKROCK BEING IN CONTRAVENTION OF THE REQUIREMENT TO FILE NOTIFICATION FILINGS WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME.  BLACKROCK HAS AGREED TO PAY THE FINE.

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN (FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN)
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A SWEDISH ISSUER.
Allegations: THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INC. HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, REPORTS THAT ITS COLLECTIVE OWNERSHIP OF SECURITIES IN THE SWEDISH ISSUER, ASSA ABLOY AB, CROSSED CERTAIN OWNERSHIP THRESHOLDS.

Summary: BLACKROCK, INC., PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON JANUARY 27, 2014

Initiated By: NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL ("AG")
Allegations: THE AG ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF CERTAIN ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW
Other Sanctions Ordered: AGREEMENT OF DISCONTINUANCE
Sanction Detail: BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS.
Summary: ON JANUARY 8, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. ("BLACKROCK") ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE ("AOD") WITH THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE ("AG") TO SETTLE ALLEGATIONS BY THE AG THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW.  THE AGREEMENT DID NOT INVOLVE THE PAYMENT OF ANY FINE OR OTHER PENALTY.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS AND AGREED TO PAY THE AG $400,000 TOWARDS THE COST OF ITS INVESTIGATION.

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA
Allegations: THE ITALIAN SECURITIES REGULATOR, COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA ("CONSOB"), INITIATED A CIVIL PROCEEDING ON JANUARY 3, 2014 AGAINST NIGEL BOLTON, A PORTFOLIO MANAGER AND HEAD OF BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED'S ("BLACKROCK") EUROPEAN EQUITY TEAM ("EET"), IN CONNECTION WITH THE SALE OF SHARES IN THE ITALIAN OIL AND GAS SERVICES COMPANY SAIPEM, SPA IN JANUARY 2013.   CONSOB ALLEGES THAT MR. BOLTON, ON BEHALF OF CERTAIN BLACKROCK CLIENTS, SOLD, OR INFLUENCED THE SALE OF, APPROXIMATELY 10.7 MILLION SHARES OF SAIPEM USING MATERIAL, NON-PUBLIC INFORMATION THEREBY AVOIDING CLIENT LOSSES OF OVER 114.5 MILLION EUROS. WHILE BLACKROCK IS NOT CHARGED IN THE PROCEEDING, IT MAY BE LIABLE FOR THE ACTIONS OF MR. BOLTON.
Summary: BLACKROCK CONDUCTED A THOROUGH INVESTIGATION AND FOUND NO EVIDENCE TO SUPPORT THE ALLEGATIONS. AS A RESULT OF THE INVESTIGATION, BLACKROCK BELIEVES THAT THE SALE OF SAIPEM SHARES WAS MADE AS A FIDUCIARY BASED ON PUBLICLY AVAILABLE INFORMATION THAT WAS WIDELY DISSEMINATED IN THE MARKETPLACE, INCLUDING NEGATIVE PUBLICITY AND A THIRD-PARTY ANALYST RESEARCH REPORT REDUCING EARNINGS ESTIMATES, WHICH WAS ISSUED TO THE MARKET BEFORE TRADING ON JANUARY 25, 2013. INSIDER TRADING IS ABHORRENT TO BLACKROCK'S VALUES, AND BLACKROCK DOES NOT TOLERATE IT.  WHILE UNDER ITALIAN LAW THE POTENTIAL PENALTY COULD BE GREATER THAN THE LOSS ACTUALLY AVOIDED, BLACKROCK BELIEVES THAT MR. BOLTON WILL NOT BE FOUND LIABLE AND, AS A RESULT, NEITHER MR. BOLTON NOR BLACKROCK WILL INCUR ANY PENALTY. NONE OF BLACKROCK'S CLIENTS OR ANY OF THE FUNDS MANAGED BY BLACKROCK WILL BE AFFECTED BY THESE PROCEEDINGS.

Initiated By: BUNDESANSTALT FR FINANZDIENSTLEISTUNGSAUFSICHT ("BAFIN")
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN SHARES OF ISSUERS WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY ("GERMAN ISSUERS")
Allegations: BAFIN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED ("BIM UK"), AS FILING AGENT FOR CERTAIN OF ITS AFFILIATES, HAD MADE INCORRECT OR LATE REPORTS IN CONTRAVENTION OF GERMAN THRESHOLDS REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.
Sanction Detail: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 3.25 MILLION EUROS AGAINST BIM UK.  AN ADDITIONAL 7,500 EUROS WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT OF AN ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGE.
Summary: IN 2014, BIM UK SELF-REPORTED TO BAFIN THAT CERTAIN DISCLOSURES WERE EITHER INCORRECT OR LATE. BIM UK WORKED CLOSELY WITH BAFIN TO REMEDY THE RELEVANT DISCLOSURES AND INFORMED THE APPROPRIATE ISSUERS, AND THE BROADER MARKET, ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2014.  ON MARCH 20, 2015, BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 3.25 MILLION EUROS AGAINST BIM UK.  AN ADDITIONAL        7,500 EUROS WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT OF AN ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGE. BIM UK PAID THE FINE AND ADMINISTRATION CHARGE TOTALING  3,257,500 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $3,563,216 USD) ON MARCH 26, 2015.

Initiated By: THE UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: CIVIL AND ADMINISTRATIVE PENALTY(IES)/FINES(S), CENSURE, DISGORGEMENT, UNDERTAKING
Allegations: ALLEGED VIOLATIONS OF INVESTMENT ADVISORS ACT SECTION 206(4) AND RULE 206(4)-5 THEREUNDER AND ALLEGED VIOLATIONS OF INVESTMENT ADVISORS ACT SECTIONS 203(A) AND 208(D)
Sanction Detail: TL VENTURES PAID A TOTAL OF $294,894 ON JUNE 26, 2014.
Summary: THE ACTION WAS RESOLVED PURSUANT TO COMMISSION ORDER: IN THE MATTER OF TL VENTURES INC., ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING FILE NO. 3-15940 (JUNE 20, 2014) ("ORDER"). PURSUANT TO THE ORDER, TL VENTURES WAS ORDERED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS AND ANY FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 203(A) OF THE ADVISERS ACT, INCLUDING COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY SUCH VIOLATIONS INDIRECTLY, OR THROUGH OR BY ANY OTHER PERSON, AS PROHIBITED BY SECTION 208(D) OF THE ADVISERS ACT, AND TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS AND ANY FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 206(4) OF THE ADVISERS ACT AND RULE 206(4)-5 THEREUNDER.  ADDITIONALLY, PURSUANT TO THE ORDER, TL VENTURES WAS CENSURED.  ADDITIONALLY, PURSUANT TO THE ORDER, TL VENTURES WAS ORDERED TO, WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THE ENTRY OF THE ORDER, PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $256,697 AND PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $3,197 TO THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION.  ADDITIONALLY, PURSUANT TO THE ORDER, TL VENTURES WAS ORDERED TO, WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THE ENTRY OF THE ORDER, PAY A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $35,000 TO THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION.  IN DETERMINING TO ACCEPT THE OFFER OF SETTLEMENT, THE SEC CONSIDERED REMEDIAL ACTS THAT TL VENTURES WAS UNDERTAKING AT THE TIME OF THE ORDER, INCLUDING STEPS TO REORGANIZE OPERATIONS AND SEPARATE ITS ADVISORY FUNCTIONS FROM PENN MEZZANINE, AS WELL AS THE ADOPTION OF POLICIES AND PROCEDURES REASONABLY DESIGNED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE RULES.

Initiated By: COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION.
Other Sanctions: CEASE AND DESIST.
Allegations: VIOLATIONS OF 6(C), 6(D) AND 9(A)(2) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT.
Sanction Detail: LLOYDS BANKING GROUP (THE "GROUP") AND LLOYDS BANK PLC ("LLOYDS BANK") CONSENTED TO AN ORDER TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATION SECTIONS 6(C) 6(D) AND 9(A)(2) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT.
Summary: ON 28 JULY 2014, THE GROUP ANNOUNCED THAT IT HAD REACHED SETTLEMENTS TO RESOLVE WITH UK AND US FEDERAL AUTHORITIES LEGACY ISSUES REGARDING THE MANIPULATION SEVERAL YEARS AGO OF GROUP COMPANIES' SUBMISSIONS TO THE BRITISH BANKERS' ASSOCIATION (BBA), LONDON INTERBANK OFFERED RATE (LIBOR) AND STERLING REPO RATE.  ON LIBOR, CERTAIN MEMBERS OF THE GROUP HAVE  REACHED SETTLEMENTS WITH THE FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY (FCA) IN THE UK , THE US COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION (CFTC) AND THE US DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE (DOJ) IN RELATION TO INVESTIGATIONS INTO SUBMISSIONS BETWEEN MAY 2006 AND 2009 AND RELATED SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS FAILINGS.   FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING THE FCA AND DOJ SETTLEMENTS ARE INCLUDED IN OTHER DRPS INCLUDED HEREWITH.  THE SETTLEMENTS IN RELATION TO LIBOR ARE PART OF AN INDUSTRY-WIDE INVESTIGATION INTO THE SETTING OF INTERBANK OFFERED RATES ACROSS A RANGE OF CURRENCIES. UNDER THE SETTLEMENT, THE GROUP HAS AGREED TO PAY APPROXIMATELY $179 MILLION (AT CURRENT EXCHANGE RATES), $105 MILLION AND $86 MILLION TO THE FCA, CFTC AND DOJ RESPECTIVELY. AS PART OF THE SETTLEMENT WITH THE DOJ, THE GROUP HAS ALSO ENTERED INTO A TWO-YEAR DEFERRED PROSECUTION AGREEMENT IN RELATION TO ONE COUNT OF WIRE FRAUD RELATING TO THE SETTING OF LIBOR. BOTH THE CFTC AND DOJ SETTLEMENTS ARE IN RESPECT OF LIBOR ONLY AND NEITHER AGENCY HAS TAKEN ACTION REGARDING THE BBA REPO RATE; ONLY THE FCA HAS DONE SO.

Allegations: ALLEGED VIOLATIONS OF THE U.S. ECONOMIC SANCTIONS AGAINST IRAN, SUDAN AND LIBYA.

Initiated By: UK FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY
Allegations: ALLEGED BREACHES OF SIB ADOPTED RULE S5.01 ("THE SIB RULE") AND PRINCIPLES 2 AND 9 OF THE STATEMENTS OF PRINCIPLE OF THE SECURITIES AND INVESTMENTS BOARD ("THE SIB PRINCIPLES") ARISING FROM THE SALE OF SOME 51,000 POLICIES OF THE EXTRA INCOME AND GROWTH PLAN ("EIGP") IN FOUR TRANCHES BETWEEN OCTOBER 2000 AND JULY 2001. BRANCH ADVISORS WERE NOT SUFFICIENTLY TRAINED TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON THE SUITABILITY OF THE EIGP FOR INVESTORS ON GROUNDS OF CONCENTRATION LEVELS. IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH GUIDANCE, THE SALES VERIFICATION PROCESS DID NOT IDENTIFY POTENTIAL UNSUITABLE SALES THROUGH THE NETWORK ON GROUNDS OF CONCENTRATION LEVELS AND IT DID NOT ENSURE AN ADEQUATE BALANCE BETWEEN THE GENERAL PRESSURES OF ITS SALES TARGETS AND THE SUITABILITY OF EIGP FOR INVESTORS.
Other Sanctions Ordered: ON 23 SEPTEMBER 2003 THE FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY FINED LLOYDS TSB BANK PLC 1.9 MILLION STERLING IN RESPECT OF BREACHES ARISING FROM THE SALE OF FOUR TRANCHES OF ITS EXTRA INCOME AND GROWTH PLAN BETWEEN OCTOBER 2000 AND JULY 2001. LLOYDS TSB BANK PLC ALSO AGREED TO PAY COMPENSATION TO IMPACTED CUSTOMERS
Sanction Detail: SEE 12B
Summary: SEE 12B.   THE AMOUNT IN ITEM 12A IS STERLING  NOT DOLLARS $

Allegations: FAILURES IN THEIR SYSTEMS WHICH MEANT IT HELD INACCURATE MORTGAGE RECORDS FOR 250,000 OF ITS CUSTOMERS. Date Initiated Explanation: THE FSA HAS PUBLISHED A FINAL NOTICE DETAILING ITS FINDINGS IN RESPECT OF FAILINGS OF BANK OF SCOTLAND PLC ('BANK OF SCOTLAND'), A SUBSIDIARY OF THE HBOS GROUP, IN RELATION TO ITS CORPORATE DIVISION ('THE DIVISION') DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 2006 TO DECEMBER 2008.

Allegations: CENSURE ISSUED POST LBG ACQUISITION OF HBOS IN JANUARY 2009 BUT RELATES TO PRE-ACQUISITION ACTIVITY.THE FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY HAS CONFIRMED PUBLICLY THAT IT HAS BEEN CARRYING OUT AN ENFORCEMENT INVESTIGATION INTO HBOS IN RESPECT OF SPECIFIC ISSUES RELEVANT TO ITS FAILURE DURING THE WIDER FINANCIAL CRISIS. THE INVESTIGATION INTO THE FIRM HAS NOW CONCLUDED AND THE FSA HAS PUBLISHED A FINAL NOTICE DETAILING ITS FINDINGS IN RESPECT OF FAILINGS OF BANK OF SCOTLAND PLC ('BANK OF SCOTLAND'), A SUBSIDIARY OF THE HBOS GROUP, IN RELATION TO ITS CORPORATE DIVISION ('THE DIVISION') DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 2006 TO DECEMBER 2008. THE FSA CONSIDERS THAT DURING THIS PERIOD, BANK OF SCOTLAND FAILED TO COMPLY WITH PRINCIPLE 3 OF THE FSA'S PRINCIPLES FOR BUSINESSES. PRINCIPLE 3 STATES: "A FIRM MUST TAKE REASONABLE CARE TO ORGANISE AND CONTROL ITS AFFAIRS RESPONSIBLY AND EFFECTIVELY, WITH ADEQUATE RISK MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS".
Sanction Detail: CENSURE-THE FSA CONSIDERS THAT DURING THIS PERIOD, BANK OF SCOTLAND FAILED TO COMPLY WITH PRINCIPLE 3 OF THE FSA'S PRINCIPLES FOR BUSINESSES. PRINCIPLE 3 STATES: "A FIRM MUST TAKE REASONABLE CARE TO ORGANISE AND CONTROL ITS AFFAIRS RESPONSIBLY AND EFFECTIVELY, WITH ADEQUATE RISK MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS".
Summary: FINAL DISPOSITION- PUBLIC CENSURE.
