Initiated By: THE UK FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY
Allegations: LLOYDS BANKING GROUP SETTLEMENT ON PPI COMPLAINT HANDLING - 2013 ON 15 FEBRUARY 2013 LLOYDS BANKING GROUP PLC (LBG) REACHED A SETTLEMENT WITH THE UK'S FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY (FSA) TOTALLING 4,315,000 WITH REGARD TO ITS PAYMENT PROTECTION INSURANCE (PPI) COMPLAINT HANDLING PROCESS.  PPI IS AN INSURANCE PRODUCT SOLD PRIMARILY TO LBG'S UK RETAIL BANKING CUSTOMERS IN CONNECTION WITH LOANS, CREDIT CARDS, MORTGAGES AND OTHER DEBT WHICH IS DESIGNED TO HELP MEET REPAYMENTS WHEN THE CUSTOMER IS UNABLE TO MAKE REPAYMENTS IN CIRCUMSTANCES SUCH AS ACCIDENT, SICKNESS OR UNEMPLOYMENT.   THE FSA IMPOSED A PENALTY ON LLOYDS TSB BANK PLC, LLOYDS TSB SCOTLAND PLC AND BANK OF SCOTLAND PLC BECAUSE THE FSA FOUND THAT THEY HAD BREACHED PRINCIPLE 3 OF THE FSA'S PRINCIPLES FOR BUSINESS AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION RULE 1.4.1R(5) ON THE BASIS THAT THEY FAILED TO PAY REDRESS PROMPTLY TO CERTAIN PPI COMPLAINANTS BETWEEN 5 MAY 2011 AND 9 MARCH 2012.  THE FIRMS AGREED TO SETTLE AT AN EARLY STAGE OF THE FSA'S INVESTIGATION AND THEREFORE QUALIFIED FOR A 30% DISCOUNT UNDER THE FSA'S EXECUTIVE SETTLEMENT PROCEDURES.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: N/A
Sanction Detail: LLOYDS BANKING GROUP PLC (LBG) REACHED A SETTLEMENT WITH THE UK'S FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY (FCA), PREVIOUSLY FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY (FSA) TOTALLING 4,315,000
Summary: SETTLEMENT REACHED WITH THE UK FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY ON THE 5TH JUNE 2015. FURTHER DETAILS PROVIDED UNDER QUESTION 7.

Initiated By: THE SWEDISH FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY, "FINANSINSPEKTIONEN"
Allegations: THE SWEDISH REGULATOR FINANSINSPEKTIONEN ORDERED F&C ASSET MANAGEMENT PLC (THE LISTED UNREGULATED HOLDING COMPANY OF THE F&C GROUP) TO PAY SEK 550,000 (APPROX USD 78,000) BECAUSE OF ITS OMISSION ON THREE OCCASIONS DURING THE PERIOD MAY 2007 - MAY 2008 TO REPORT WITHIN STIPULATED DISCLOSURE DEADLINES CHANGES TO OWNERSHIP IN ZODIAK TELEVISION ACROSS CLIENT ACCOUNTS THAT THE F&C GROUP MANAGES. REPORTS WERE FILED WITH THE REGULATOR AS SOON AS THE OMISSIONS CAME TO LIGHT. THE OMISSIONS OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF HISTORICAL ADMINISTRATIVE ERRORS IN F&C GROUP'S SHAREHOLDING DISCLOSURE PROCESS, WHICH HAVE SINCE BEEN RECTIFIED. IN 2010, A MAJOR PROJECT WAS COMPLETED WITHIN THE F&C GROUP TO REVAMP COMPLETELY THE SHARE OWNERSHIP DISCLOSURE PROCESS TO ENABLE FULL COMPLIANCE WITH EVER CHANGING GLOBAL REGULATORY DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS.
Sanction Detail: THE FULL FINE AMOUNT OF SEK 550,000 (APPROXIMATELY USD 78,000) WAS PAID ON 20 JUNE 2011 BY F&C ASSET MANAGEMENT PLC, AS ADVISORY AFFILIATE.
Summary: THE FINE WAS CONFIRMED IN A LETTER TO F&C ASSET MANAGEMENT PLC FROM THE REGULATOR ON 28 APRIL 2011 AND WAS SUBSEQUENTLY PAID IN JUNE 2011. THIS MATTER IS NOW CLOSED.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION, HONG KONG
Allegations: IN FEBURARY 08, EACH OF GREENWOODS ASSET MANAGEMENT LIMITED (THE ADVISOR), GOLDEN CHINA MASTER FUND (THE FUND), AND JIANG JIN ZHI (THE PORTFOLIO MANAGER) WAS FINED HK$6,000 BY THE GOVERNMENT OF THE HONG KONG SPECIAL ADMINISTRATIVE REGION EASTERN MAGISTRACY FOR THE LATE DISCLOSURE OF THE EQUITY INTERESTS IN A HONG KONG LISTED COMPANY IN 2006 (THE HK$6,000 FINE OF GOLDEN CHINA FUND WAS PAID BY GREENWOODS ASSET MANAGEMENT HONG KONG LIMITED).  UNDER HK SECURITIES RULES, IF AN INVESTOR HOLDS MORE THAN 5% OF THE ISSUED SHARE CAPITAL OF A LISTED COMPANY, SHE/HE MUST TO FILE A DISCLOSURE OF INTEREST NOTICE ("DI NOTICE") TO THE HONG KONG STOCK EXCHANGE WITHIN 3 BUSINESS DAYS OF ACQUIRING SUCH INTEREST.   IN 2006, GOLDEN CHINA MASTER FUND PURCHASED THE SHARES OF A COMPANY WHICH IS DUALLY-LISTED IN BOTH THE SHANGHAI STOCK EXCHANGE (A SHARES) AND HONG KONG STOCK EXCHANGE (H SHARES).  IN MAY 2006, GOLDEN CHINA MASTER FUND HELD AROUND 14 MILLION H SHARES OF THE COMPANY, ACCOUNTING FOR 6.5% OF THE H SHARES ISSUED, BUT ONLY 1.8% OF THE TOTAL ISSUED SHARE CAPITAL.   GREENWOODS ASSET MANAGEMENT LIMITED BELIEVED THAT THE 5% THRESHOLD FOR THE DI NOTICE RULE IS BASED ON THE TOTAL ISSUED SHARE CAPITAL AND THEREFORE DID NOT FILE THE DI NOTICE, WHILE THE 5% THRESHOLD IS ACTUALLY BASED ON A SINGLE CLASS OF SHARES (H SHARES IN THIS CASE).  GREENWOODS EVENTUALLY FILED THE DI NOTICE, AND PAID A FINE OF HKD18000 IN EARLY 2008.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION INVESTIGATION FEE HKD3,474 FOR EACH PERSON
Sanction Detail: AMOUNT PENALTY PAID: HKD 6,000 FOR EACH CHARGE, 3 CHARGES IN TOTAL.
Summary: AMOUNT PENALTY PAID: HKD 6,000 FOR EACH CHARGE, 3 CHARGES IN TOTAL, PAID ON 29 FEB 2008.

Initiated By: FINANCIAL MARKET AUTHORITY
Allegations: THE FINANCIAL MARKET AUTHORITY (AMF) FINED SOCIETE GENERALE 500,000 EUROS FOR (I) BREACHING ARTICLE 332-6 OF THE GENERAL REGULATION OF AMF BY FAILING TO PROVE THE EXISTENCE OF CLIENT INSTRUCTIONS FOR A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF SUBSCRIPTIONS TO THE PUBLIC OFFERING BY THE EDF GROUP AND (II) BREACHING ARTICLES 321-24. 321-42, 321-43, 321-47, AND 321-76 OF THE GENERAL REGULATION OF THE AMF BY REDUCING THE SIZE OF CERTAIN SUBSCRIPTION ORDERS AND FAILING TO HAVE IN PLACE SUFFICIENT SUPERVISORY TOOLS IN THIS AREA.
Sanction Detail: THE AMF FINED SOCIETE GENERALE 500,000 EUROS = $696,700 AS OF 09/11/2008
Summary: PLEASE SEE EXPLANATION ABOVE. THE MATTER IS FINAL.

Initiated By: EUROPEAN COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: FINE OF EUR 445.9 MILLION
Date Initiated Explanation: DATE ORIGINAL DECISION WAS ISSUED BY EUROPEAN COMMISSION
Allegations: INTERNAL INVESTIGATION CARRIED OUT BY THE BANK FOR NEARLY TWO YEARS IN CLOSE COOPERATION WITH THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION UNCOVERED SOME ATTEMPTS TO MANIPULATE THE EURIBOR RATE, DATING BACK TO A LIMITED TIME PERIOD BETWEEN MARCH 2006 AND MAY 2008. HOWEVER, THE EVENTS OCCURRED FOR THE MOST PART OVER ONE YEAR, BETWEEN MARCH 2006 AND MARCH 2007. ON 4 DECEMBER 2013, THE EUROPEAN COMMISSION ISSUED A DECISION FURTHER TO ITS INVESTIGATION INTO THE EURIBOR RATE, THAT PROVIDES FOR THE PAYMENT BY SOCIETE GENERALE OF AN AMOUNT OF EUR 445.9 MILLION IN RELATION TO EVENTS THAT OCCURRED BETWEEN MARCH 2006 AND MAY 2008. SOCIETE GENERALE HAS FILED AN APPEAL WITH THE EU GENERAL COURT REGARDING THE METHOD USED TO DETERMINE THE VALUE OF THE SALES THAT SERVED AS A BASIS FOR THE CALCULATION OF THE FINE.
Appeal Details: APPEAL FILED WITH THE EU GENERAL COURT ON FEBRUARY 14, 2014, CASE T-98/14, SOCIT GNRALE V COMMISSION
Resolution Date Explanation: DATE OF DECISION: DECEMBER 4, 2013; DATE OF APPEAL: FEBRUARY 14, 2014
Other Sanctions Ordered: EUR 445.9 MILLION, ON APPEAL CHALLENGING METHOD USED TO DETERMINE FINE.
Sanction Detail: EUR 445.9 MILLION, ON APPEAL CHALLENGING METHOD USED TO DETERMINE FINE.
Summary: PLEASE SEE EXPLANATION ABOVE. THE MATTER IS ON APPEAL

Initiated By: FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY (FSA) UNITED KINGDOM
Allegations: DURING THE PERIOD FROM NOVEMBER 2007 TO FEBRUARY 2010, SOCIETE GENERALE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM (I) DID NOT SUBMIT TRADE REPORTING DATA FOR REPORTABLE TRANSACTIONS OR SUBMITTED INACCURATE DATA IN SUCH REPORTS IN 18.8 MILLION OF ITS 23.5 MILLION REPORTABLE TRANSACTIONS, AND (II) DID NOT RETAIN AND HAVE AVAILABLE SUCH TRADE REPORTING DATA, IN VIOLATION OF FSA RULES.
Sanction Detail: SOCIETE GENERALE WAS FINED 1.575 MILLION BRITISH POUNDS
Summary: SEE ABOVE

Initiated By: THE FRENCH COMPETITION AUTHORITY (AUTORITE DE LA CONCURRENCE).
Other Sanctions: FINE
Allegations: FOLLOWING AN INVESTIGATION, THE FRENCH COMPETITION AUTHORITY (AUTORITE DE LA CONCURRENCE) ISSUED A DECISION FINDING THAT (11) MAJOR FRENCH RETAIL BANKS, INCLUDING SOCIETE GENERALE AND ITS SUBSIDIARY, CREDIT DU NORD, HAD ENGAGED IN ANTICOMPETITIVE ACTIVITY IN CONNECTION WITH FEES ASSOCIATED WITH ELECTRONIC CHECK PROCESSING SERVICES AND CERTAIN OTHER FEES FOR RELATED SERVICES IN FRANCE. THE FRENCH COMPETITION AUTHORITY FOUND THAT A FEE OF 0.043 EUROS PER CHECK WAS UNJUSTIFIED AND AN INFRINGEMENT OF COMPETITION RULES IN FRANCE AND THAT CERTAIN OTHER FEES WERE NOT PROPORTIONATE TO COSTS INCURRED BY THE BANKS. THE PRIMARY PROCESSING FEES WERE CHARGED BETWEEN JANUARY 2002 AND JULY 2007. THE GROUP OF ELEVEN BANKS WAS FINED A TOTAL OF 384.92 MILLION EUROS. SOCIETE GENERALE WAS FINED 53.47 MILLION EUROS AND CREDIT DU NORD WAS FINED 6.98 MILLION EUROS.
Appeal Details: COURT OF APPEALS OF PARIS (COUR D'APPEL DE PARIS)
Other Sanctions Ordered: FINE OF 53.47 MILLION EUROS FOR SOCIETE GENERALE AND 6.98 MILLION EUROS FOR CREDIT DU NORD
Sanction Detail: SOCIETE GENERALE WAS FINED 53.47 MILLION EUROS. CREDIT DU NORD WAS FINED 6.98 MILLION EUROS.
Summary: THE MATTER IS CURRENTLY BEING APPEALED.

Initiated By: COMMISSION BANCAIRE (FRANCE)
Other Sanctions: FINE
Date Initiated Explanation: HEARING ON 6/20/2008, DECISION ANNOUNCED ON 7/03/2008
Allegations: FOLLOWING THE ANNOUNCEMENT ON JANUARY 24, 2008 BY SOCIETE GENERALE OF SIGNIFICANT LOSSES FROM CERTAIN UNAUTHORIZED TRADING ACTIVITY IN ITS PARIS OFFICE, THE FRENCH COMMISSION BANCAIRE REPRIMANDED AND FINED SOCIETE GENERALE EURO 4 MILLION FOR BREACHING REGULATORY PROVISIONS CONCERNING INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES (FRENCH BANKING AND REGULATORY COMMITTEE REGULATION NO 97-02). THE REFERENCED REGULATORY ACTION RELATES SOLELY TO THE ULTIMATE PARENT COMPANY OF THE REGISTRANT IN PARIS, FRANCE AND HAS NO BEARING ON OR RELATIONSHIP TO THE BUSINESS OF THE REGISTRANT.
Other Sanctions Ordered: THE AMOUNT OF THE FINE WAS EURO 4 MILLION. THE $6 MILLION REFLECTED ABOVE IS THE APPROXIMATE CURRENT VALUE OF THE FINE IN THE UNITED STATES.
Sanction Detail: THE FRENCH COMMISSION BANCAIRE REPRIMANDED AND FINED SOCIETE GENERALE EURO 4 MILLION.
Summary: SEE EXPLANATION ABOVE.

Initiated By: AUTORITE DES MARCHES FINANCIERS (AMF)
Date Initiated Explanation: ON OR ABOUT 11/22/2011
Allegations: FOLLOWING AN INVESTIGATION, THE AMF ISSUED A DECISION FINDING THAT, IN CONNECTION WITH SELLING ASSETS BETWEEN JUNE 2007 AND JUNE 2008, SG ASSET MANAGEMENT ("SGAM") FAILED TO EXECUTE OR EFFECTIVELY FULFIL CERTAIN RISK CONTROL AND COMPLIANCE FUNCTIONS. FOLLOWING AN INVESTIGATION, THE AMF ISSUED A DECISION FINDING THAT SG ASSET MANAGAMENT ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS ("SGAM AI") FAILED TO EXECUTE OR EFFECTIVELY FULFIL CERTAIN RISK CONTROL AND COMPLIANCE FUNCTIONS IN CONNECTION WITH OVERTAKING RATIOS AND CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WITH AFFILIATE SGAM BANK. IN ADDITION, IN CONNECTION WITH ONE INVESTEMENT FUND THE AMF FOUND THAT SGAM AI PUTS ITS INTERETS BEFORE THOSE OF THE INVESTORS IN THE FUND BY MAINTAINING THE FUND'S INVESTMENT IN SGAM AI CREDIT COURT TERME.
Resolution Date Explanation: ON OR ABOUT 11/22/2011
Other Sanctions Ordered: SGAM WAS FINED 1 MILLION EUROS. SGAM AI WAS FINED 1.5 MILLION EUROS. TOTAL FINE OF BOTH ENTITIES WAS FOR 2.5 MILLION EUROS = $3,280,000 US DOLLARS.
Sanction Detail: SGAM WAS FINED 1 MILLION EUROS. SGAM AI WAS FINED 1.5 MILLION EUROS. TOTAL FINE OF BOTH ENTITIES WAS FOR 2.5 MILLION EUROS = $3,280,000 US DOLLARS.
Summary: SGAM WAS FINED 1 MILLION EUROS. SGAM AI WAS FINED 1.5 MILLION EUROS. TOTAL FINE OF BOTH ENTITIES WAS FOR 2.5 MILLION EUROS = $3,280,000 US DOLLARS.

Initiated By: THE SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION (SFC) (HONG KONG)
Other Sanctions: REIMBURSEMENT OF CUSTOMERS; ENGAGEMENT OF INDEPENDENT REVIEWER
Date Initiated Explanation: ON OR AROUND 7/17/2012
Other Product: OVER-THE-COUNTER BONDS, OPTIONS AND STRUCTURED NOTES.
Allegations: THE SECURITIES AND FUTURES COMMISSION ("SFC") ALLEGED THAT, IN OVER 3,000 TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN APRIL 2003 AND JANUARY 2006, SOCIETE GENERALE, HONG KONG BRANCH FAILED TO ADEQUATELY DISCLOSE TO CUSTOMERS OF ITS WEALTH MANAGEMENT UNIT CERTAIN FEES AND CHARGES IN SECONDARY MARKET TRANSACTIONS OF OVER-THE-COUNTER BONDS, OPTIONS AND STRUCTURED NOTES ("OTC TRANSACTIONS").
Resolution Date Explanation: ON OR AROUND
Other Sanctions Ordered: ENGAGEMENT OF INDEPENDENT REVIEWER
Sanction Detail: WITHOUT ADMITTING LIABILITY, SOCIETE GENERALE AGREED TO ACCEPT A REPRIMAND FROM THE SFC AND TO REIMBURSE AFFECTED CUSTOMERS THE FULL VALUE OF THE ALLEGEDLY UNDISCLOSED FEES, TOGETHER WITH INTEREST. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO ASSESS THE AMOUNT TO BE PAID TO ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS. THE TOTAL AMOUNT TO BE REIMBURSED IS EXPECTED TO BE IN EXCESS OF $11 MILLION USD. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO REVIEW THE CONTROLS, SYSTEMS AN PROCEDURES OF ITS WEALTH MANAGEMENT UNIT IN HONG KONG IN RELATION TO ITS CURRENT PRACTICE IN CHARGING CUSTOMERS IN OTC TRANSACTIONS TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE COMPLIANT WITH LEGAL AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS.
Summary: WITHOUT ADMITTING LIABILITY, SOCIETE GENERALE AGREED TO ACCEPT A REPRIMAND FROM THE SFC AND TO REIMBURSE AFFECTED CUSTOMERS THE FULL VALUE OF THE ALLEGEDLY UNDISCLOSED FEES, TOGETHER WITH INTEREST. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO ASSESS THE AMOUNT TO BE PAID TO ELIGIBLE CUSTOMERS. THE TOTAL AMOUNT TO BE REIMBURSED IS EXPECTED TO BE IN EXCESS OF $11 MILLION USD. SOCIETE GENERALE ALSO AGREED TO ENGAGE AN INDEPENDENT REVIEWER TO REVIEW THE CONTROLS, SYSTEMS AN PROCEDURES OF ITS WEALTH MANAGEMENT UNIT IN HONG KONG IN RELATION TO ITS CURRENT PRACTICE IN CHARGING CUSTOMERS IN OTC TRANSACTIONS TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE COMPLIANT WITH LEGAL AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS.

Initiated By: UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: CENSURE
Allegations: THE SEC'S ORDER FINDS THAT PEQUOT AND SAMBERG CONSENTED, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS IN THE SEC'S COMPLAINT, TO THE ENTRY OF A FINAL JUDGMENT ON JUNE 2, 2010 IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF CONNECTICUT PERMANENTLY ENJOINING THEM FROM FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 10(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER; ORDERING THEM TO PAY $15,142,020 IN DISGORGEMENT ON A JOINT AND SEVERAL BASIS, TOGETHER WITH PREJUDGMENT INTEREST THEREON IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,696,448; AND ORDERING PEQUOT AND SAMBERG EACH TO PAY A $5 MILLION CIVIL MONEY PENALTY.  BASED ON THE FOREGOING, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS IN THE SEC'S ORDER, PEQUOT AND SAMBERG CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER (1) CENSURING PEQUOT, AND (2) BARRING SAMBERG FROM ASSOCIATION WITH ANY INVESTMENT ADVISER, WITH THE EXCEPTION THAT SAMBERG, FOR A 15-MONTH PERIOD, MAY CONTINUE TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH PEQUOT AND PERFORM ADVISORY ACTIVITIES SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF COMPLETING THE WIND DOWN OF PEQUOT.
Sanction Detail: WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE SEC'S FINDINGS, PEQUOT AND SAMBERG CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER 1) CENSURING PEQUOT, AND (2) BARRING SAMBERG FROM ASSOCIATION WITH ANY INVESTMENT ADVISER, WITH THE EXCEPTION THAT SAMBERG, FOR A 15-MONTH PERIOD, MAY CONTINUE TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH PEQUOT AND PERFORM ADVISORY ACTIVITIES SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF COMPLETING THE WIND DOWN OF PEQUOT.
Summary: THE SEC'S ORDER FINDS THAT PEQUOT AND SAMBERG CONSENTED, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS IN THE SEC'S COMPLAINT, TO THE ENTRY OF A FINAL JUDGMENT ON JUNE 2, 2010 IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF CONNECTICUT PERMANENTLY ENJOINING THEM FROM FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 10(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER; ORDERING THEM TO PAY $15,142,020 IN DISGORGEMENT ON A JOINT AND SEVERAL BASIS, TOGETHER WITH PREJUDGMENT INTEREST THEREON IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,696,448; AND ORDERING PEQUOT AND SAMBERG EACH TO PAY A $5 MILLION CIVIL MONEY PENALTY.  BASED ON THE FOREGOING, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS IN THE SEC'S ORDER, PEQUOT AND SAMBERG CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER (1) CENSURING PEQUOT, AND (2) BARRING SAMBERG FROM ASSOCIATION WITH ANY INVESTMENT ADVISER, WITH THE EXCEPTION THAT SAMBERG, FOR A 15-MONTH PERIOD, MAY CONTINUE TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH PEQUOT AND PERFORM ADVISORY ACTIVITIES SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF COMPLETING THE WIND DOWN OF PEQUOT.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: CIVIL AND ADMINISTRATIVE PENALTY/FINE PREJUDGMENT INTEREST CEASE AND DESIST
Date Initiated Explanation: DATE THAT A WELLS NOTICE WAS ISSUED
Allegations: THE SEC ALLEGED THAT EB FINANCIAL GROUP, LLC AND LAURENCE ALBUKERK FAILED TO DISCLOSE MATERIAL INFORMATION IN WRITTEN OFFERING MATERIALS IN CONNECTION WITH THE SALE OF LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY INTERESTS.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: PREJUDGMENT INTEREST
Sanction Detail: EB FINANCIAL GROUP, LLC AND MR. ALBUKERK, JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY, WERE REQUIRED TO DISGORGE $203,287 AND PAY PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $7,212.28 AND A FINE OF $100,000.  ALL AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN PAID TO CERTAIN INVESTORS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER.  NO PORTION OF ANY PENALTY WAS WAIVED.
Summary: PURSUANT TO SECTION 8A OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933 AND SECTION 203(K) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT OF 1940, EB FINANCIAL GROUP, LLC AND MR. ALBUKERK SETTLED THIS MATTER WITH THE UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC") ON MARCH 14, 2012, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING ANY OF THE SEC'S CLAIMS.  EB FINANCIAL GROUP, LLC AND MR. ALBUKERK WERE REQUIRED, JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY, TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $203,287, PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $7,212.28 AND A FINE OF $100,000.  ALL AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN PAID TO CERTAIN INVESTORS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER.  EB FINANCIAL GROUP, LLC AND MR. ALBUKERK ALSO AGREED TO AN ORDER REQUIRING THEM TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 17(A)(2) OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, SECTION 204(6) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT OF 1940 AND RULE 206-4(8) THEREUNDER.

Initiated By: THE SWEDISH FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY, "FINANSINSPEKTIONEN"
Allegations: THE SWEDISH REGULATOR FINANSINSPEKTIONEN ORDERED F&C ASSET MANAGEMENT PLC (THE LISTED UNREGULATED HOLDING COMPANY OF THE F&C GROUP) TO PAY SEK 550,000 (APPROX USD 78,000) BECAUSE OF ITS OMISSION ON THREE OCCASIONS DURING THE PERIOD MAY 2007 - MAY 2008 TO REPORT WITHIN STIPULATED DISCLOSURE DEADLINES CHANGES TO OWNERSHIP IN ZODIAK TELEVISION ACROSS CLIENT ACCOUNTS THAT THE F&C GROUP MANAGES. REPORTS WERE FILED WITH THE REGULATOR AS SOON AS THE OMISSIONS CAME TO LIGHT. THE OMISSIONS OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF HISTORICAL ADMINISTRATIVE ERRORS IN F&C GROUP'S SHAREHOLDING DISCLOSURE PROCESS, WHICH HAVE SINCE BEEN RECTIFIED. IN 2010, A MAJOR PROJECT WAS COMPLETED WITHIN THE F&C GROUP TO REVAMP COMPLETELY THE SHARE OWNERSHIP DISCLOSURE PROCESS TO ENABLE FULL COMPLIANCE WITH EVER CHANGING GLOBAL REGULATORY DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS.
Sanction Detail: THE FULL FINE AMOUNT OF SEK 550,000 (APPROXIMATELY USD 78,000) WAS PAID ON 20 JUNE 2011 BY F&C ASSET MANAGEMENT PLC, AS ADVISORY AFFILIATE.
Summary: THE FINE WAS CONFIRMED IN A LETTER TO F&C ASSET MANAGEMENT PLC FROM THE REGULATOR ON 28 APRIL 2011 AND WAS SUBSEQUENTLY PAID IN JUNE 2011. THIS MATTER IS NOW CLOSED.

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA ("CONSOB")
Allegations: BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED ("BIMUK") ON BEHALF OF THE BLACKROCK GROUP OF COMPANIES MADE AN INCORRECT LARGE  SHAREHOLDER THRESHOLD FILING TO CONSOB IN DECEMBER 2011 REGARDING ITS HOLDINGS IN UNICREDIT S.P.A., ON BEHALF OF CLIENTS.  BLACKROCK DETECTED THIS ERROR, SELF-REPORTED IT TO CONSOB AND INFORMED THE MARKET OF THIS MISTAKE BACK IN JANUARY 2012.
Sanction Detail: CONSOB IMPOSED A FINE OF 150,000 EURO FOR NEGLIGENT MARKET MANIPULATION (APPROXIMATELY $205,826 USD). THE FINE WAS PAID ON MAY 8, 2014.
Summary: ON APRIL 29, 2014, CONSOB FINED BIMUK 150,000 EURO (APPROXIMATELY $205,826 USD)ON THE BASIS OF NEGLIGENT MARKET MANIPULATION ARISING FROM ITS INCORRECT LARGE SHAREHOLDER REPORT IN DECEMBER 2011.

Initiated By: HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: 3,000 EUROS
Date Initiated Explanation: THE DECISION OF THE REGULATOR WAS FIRST FORWARDED TO BLACKROCK IN MARCH 2010
Allegations: IN 2006 MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT LTD. DID NOT TIMELY FILE A REQUIRED DISCLOSURE WITH THE HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION REGARDING ITS PERCENTAGE OF TOTAL VOTING RIGHTS IN A CERTAIN GREEK-BASED COMPANY CHANGING FROM 5.01% TO 4.98% THE CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO THIS MATTER OCCURRED PRIOR TO BLACKROCK ACQUIRING MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENTS MANAGEMENT LTD.
Other Sanctions Ordered: PAYMENT OF FINE IN EUROS.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF 3,000 EUROS.
Summary: VIOLATION CHARGE INCURRED DUE TO LATE DISCLOSURE NOTIFICATION.

Initiated By: UNITED KINGDOM - FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY (FSA)
Allegations: BETWEEN OCTOBER 1, 2006 AND MARCH 31, 2010, BIMUK FAILED TO PUT TRUST LETTERS IN PLACE IN RELATION TO SOME OF THE MONEY MARKET DEPOSITS IT PLACED WITH THIRD PARTY BANKS.  THE ERROR OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF SYSTEMS CHANGES THAT FOLLOWED BLACKROCK GROUP'S ACQUISITION OF BIMUK, WHICH HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN KNOWN AS MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENT MANAGERS LIMITED.  THESE CHANGES RENDERED BIMUK'S PROCEDURES FOR SETTING UP TRUST LETTERS INNEFFECTIVE.
Sanction Detail: THE FSA HAS FINED BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED 9,533,100 POUNDS STERLING (APPROXIMATELY $15,322,551)
Summary: IN DETERMINING THE FINE THE FSA TOOK INTO ACCOUNT THAT THE MISCONDUCT WAS NOT DELIBERATE, AND THAT BIMUK SELF-REPORTED THE ISSUE TO THE FSA AND HAS SINCE REMEDIED THE SITUATION AND PUT IN PLACE ROBUST SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS RELATIVE TO THE PROCESS OF TRUST LETTERS FOR MONEY MARKET DEPOSITS PLACED WITH THIRD PARTY BANKS RELATING TO CLIENT MONEY PROTECTION. NO CLIENTS SUFFERED ANY LOSSES AS A RESULT OF THIS ERROR.  THE FINE HAS BEEN PAID TO THE FSA.

Initiated By: BUNDESANSTALT FR FINANZDIENSTLEISTUNGSAUFSICHT ("BAFIN")
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN SHARES OF ISSUERS WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY ("GERMAN ISSUERS")
Allegations: BAFIN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED ("BIM UK"), AS FILING AGENT FOR CERTAIN OF ITS AFFILIATES, HAD MADE INCORRECT OR LATE REPORTS IN CONTRAVENTION OF GERMAN THRESHOLDS REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.
Sanction Detail: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 3.25 MILLION EUROS AGAINST BIM UK.  AN ADDITIONAL 7,500 EUROS WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT OF AN ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGE.
Summary: IN 2014, BIM UK SELF-REPORTED TO BAFIN THAT CERTAIN DISCLOSURES WERE EITHER INCORRECT OR LATE. BIM UK WORKED CLOSELY WITH BAFIN TO REMEDY THE RELEVANT DISCLOSURES AND INFORMED THE APPROPRIATE ISSUERS, AND THE BROADER MARKET, ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2014.  ON MARCH 20, 2015, BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 3.25 MILLION EUROS AGAINST BIM UK.  AN ADDITIONAL        7,500 EUROS WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT OF AN ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGE. BIM UK PAID THE FINE AND ADMINISTRATION CHARGE TOTALING  3,257,500 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $3,563,216 USD) ON MARCH 26, 2015.

Initiated By: FINANSSIVALVONTA - THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF FINLAND
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A FINNISH ISSUER.
Allegations: ON SEPTEMBER 12, 2013, BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF FINLAND ("FINNISH FSA") THAT BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, A NOTIFICATION THAT THE INDIRECT AGGREGATE SHAREHOLDING IN A FINNISH ISSUER, OUTOTEC OYJ, CROSSED A CERTAIN THRESHOLD ("LATE NOTIFICATION").
Other Sanctions Ordered: THE FINNISH FSA ISSUED A PUBLIC REPRIMAND TO BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED.

Summary: BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED IS NOT APPEALING THE DECISION AND CONSIDERS THE MATTER CLOSED.

Initiated By: BAFIN, GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY
Allegations: AN ENTITY IS REQUIRED TO FILE A NOTIFICATION ("NOTIFICATION FILING") WHEN ITS SHAREHOLDINGS OF A SECURITY, WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMAN, REACH, EXCEED OR FALL BELOW PRESCRIBED LIMITS ("THRESHOLD LIMITS").  WHEN THE THRESHOLD LIMITS ARE REACHED, NOTIFICATION FILINGS ARE TO BE FILLED WITH THE GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY ("BAFIN") AND ISSUER OF THE SECURITY WITHIN A SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD.  WHILE BLACKROCK ("BLACKROCK, INC. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES") FILED THE NOTIFICATION FILINGS FOR CERTAIN SECURITIES, THE FILINGS WERE NOT COMPLETED WITHIN THE REQUIRED TIME PERIOD.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF FINE 167,503.50 EUROS
Summary: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 167,503.50 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $ 238,386 AS OF JUNE 18, 2012) FOR BLACKROCK BEING IN CONTRAVENTION OF THE REQUIREMENT TO FILE NOTIFICATION FILINGS WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME.  BLACKROCK HAS AGREED TO PAY THE FINE.

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN - THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A SWEDISH ISSUER.
Allegations: ON OCTOBER 31, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN ("SWEDISH FSA") THAT BLACKROCK, INC. HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, A NOTIFICATION THAT ITS INDIRECT AGGREGATE SHAREHOLDING IN A SWEDISH ISSUER, ASSA ABLOY AB, CROSSED A CERTAIN THRESHOLD ("LATE NOTIFICATION").
Sanction Detail: AS A RESULT OF THE LATE NOTIFICATION, THE SWEDISH FSA NOTIFIED BLACKROCK, INC., IN A LETTER DATED APRIL 29, 2015, OF ITS DECISION TO IMPOSE A PENALTY FEE OF SEK 1,000,000 (APPROXIMATELY $120,700 USD). BLACKROCK, INC. PAID THE PENALTY FEE ON JUNE 10, 2015.
Summary: THE PENALTY FEE, INVOICE DATE MAY 29, 2015, WAS PAID ON JUNE 10, 2015

Initiated By: FINANSSIVALVONTA - THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF FINLAND

Initiated By: NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL ("AG")
Allegations: THE AG ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF CERTAIN ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW
Other Sanctions Ordered: AGREEMENT OF DISCONTINUANCE
Sanction Detail: BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS.
Summary: ON JANUARY 8, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. ("BLACKROCK") ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE ("AOD") WITH THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE ("AG") TO SETTLE ALLEGATIONS BY THE AG THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW.  THE AGREEMENT DID NOT INVOLVE THE PAYMENT OF ANY FINE OR OTHER PENALTY.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS AND AGREED TO PAY THE AG $400,000 TOWARDS THE COST OF ITS INVESTIGATION.

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN (SWEDISH FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY (THE "SFSA")
Allegations: THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN (THE "SFSA") ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK, INC. VIOLATED LOCAL SWEDISH LAW BY NOT FILING IN SWEDEN, WITHIN A PRESCRIBED TIME, REPORTS THAT ITS COLLECTIVE SHAREHOLDINGS IN LUNDIN MINING CORPORATION (A CANADIAN COMPANY WITH A PRIMARY LISTING ON TORONTO STOCK EXCHANGE AND A LISTING OF SWEDISH DEPOSITARY RECEIPTS ON NASDAQ OMX STOCKHOLM) CROSSED CERTAIN OWNERSHIP THRESHOLDS.
Sanction Detail: FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN IMPOSED A SPECIAL FEE OF 1,000,000 SEK (APPROXIMATELY $138,200 USD). BLACKROCK, INC. PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON OCTOBER 15, 2014.
Summary: BLACKROCK, INC. PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON OCTOBER 15, 2014

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA
Allegations: THE ITALIAN SECURITIES REGULATOR, COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA ("CONSOB"), INITIATED A CIVIL PROCEEDING ON JANUARY 3, 2014 AGAINST NIGEL BOLTON, A PORTFOLIO MANAGER AND HEAD OF BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED'S ("BLACKROCK") EUROPEAN EQUITY TEAM ("EET"), IN CONNECTION WITH THE SALE OF SHARES IN THE ITALIAN OIL AND GAS SERVICES COMPANY SAIPEM, SPA IN JANUARY 2013.   CONSOB ALLEGES THAT MR. BOLTON, ON BEHALF OF CERTAIN BLACKROCK CLIENTS, SOLD, OR INFLUENCED THE SALE OF, APPROXIMATELY 10.7 MILLION SHARES OF SAIPEM USING MATERIAL, NON-PUBLIC INFORMATION THEREBY AVOIDING CLIENT LOSSES OF OVER 114.5 MILLION EUROS. WHILE BLACKROCK IS NOT CHARGED IN THE PROCEEDING, IT MAY BE LIABLE FOR THE ACTIONS OF MR. BOLTON.
Summary: BLACKROCK CONDUCTED A THOROUGH INVESTIGATION AND FOUND NO EVIDENCE TO SUPPORT THE ALLEGATIONS. AS A RESULT OF THE INVESTIGATION, BLACKROCK BELIEVES THAT THE SALE OF SAIPEM SHARES WAS MADE AS A FIDUCIARY BASED ON PUBLICLY AVAILABLE INFORMATION THAT WAS WIDELY DISSEMINATED IN THE MARKETPLACE, INCLUDING NEGATIVE PUBLICITY AND A THIRD-PARTY ANALYST RESEARCH REPORT REDUCING EARNINGS ESTIMATES, WHICH WAS ISSUED TO THE MARKET BEFORE TRADING ON JANUARY 25, 2013. INSIDER TRADING IS ABHORRENT TO BLACKROCK'S VALUES, AND BLACKROCK DOES NOT TOLERATE IT.  WHILE UNDER ITALIAN LAW THE POTENTIAL PENALTY COULD BE GREATER THAN THE LOSS ACTUALLY AVOIDED, BLACKROCK BELIEVES THAT MR. BOLTON WILL NOT BE FOUND LIABLE AND, AS A RESULT, NEITHER MR. BOLTON NOR BLACKROCK WILL INCUR ANY PENALTY. NONE OF BLACKROCK'S CLIENTS OR ANY OF THE FUNDS MANAGED BY BLACKROCK WILL BE AFFECTED BY THESE PROCEEDINGS.

Initiated By: ATTORNEY GENERAL FOR THE STATE OF NEW YORK
Date Initiated Explanation: THE NY AG COMMENCED ITS INDUSTRY-WIDE INVESTIGATION THAT LED TO THE ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE (EACH DISCUSSED BELOW) IN MARCH OF 2007. WETHERLY (AS DEFINED BELOW) WAS FIRST CONTACT IN EARLY 2009.
Employing Firm: WETHERLY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC AND DAV/WETHERLY FINANCIAL, L.P. (COLLECTIVELY, "WETHERLY")
Other Product: PRIVATE FUND INVESTMENTS BY PUBLIC PENSION PLANS
Allegations: IN 3/2007, THE NY AG COMMENCED AN INDUSTRY-WIDE INVESTIGATION INTO, AMONG OTHER THINGS, ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND CORRUPTION INVOLVING INVESTMENT FIRMS' USE OF PLACEMENT AGENTS TO OBTAIN INVESTMENTS FROM PUBLIC PENSION PLANS. THE WETHERLY INVESTIGATION FOCUSED PRIMARILY ON CERTAIN SUB-AGENTS USED BY WETHERLY W/R/T THE NY CRF.  IN FEBRUARY, 2010, WETHERLY AND THE NY AG'S OFFICE ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE PURSUANT TO WHICH MS. SCHIFF (WHO WAS NOT PERSONALLY SUBJECT OF THE INVESTIGATION) AGREED TO REFRAIN FROM BEING ENGAGED BY AN INVESTMENT FIRM TO ADVISE ANY PUBLIC PENSION FUND, OTHER THAN WHEN ACTING AS A PRINCIPAL, SHAREHOLDER OR EMPLOYEE OF THE ENGAGING FIRM.
Resolution Date Explanation: THE RESOLUTION INVOLVED THE ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE
Other Sanctions Ordered: MS. SCHIFF WAS NOT PERSONALLY THE SUBJECT OF THE NY AG'S INVESTIGATION, BUT AGREED TO BE BOUND BY THE AG'S PUBLIC PENSION FUND CODE OF CONDUCT AND REFRAIN FROM THE ACTIVITIES DISCUSSED BELOW.
Sanction Detail: IN AGREEING TO BE BOUND BY THE AG'S PUBLIC PENSION FUND CODE OF CONDUCT, MS. SCHIFF AGREED TO THE PRECLUSION DISCUSSED BELOW COMMENCING IN FEBRUARY, 2010.
Summary: THIS ACTION WAS CONCLUDED IN FEBRUARY 2010, AND THERE HAS BEEN NO SUBSEQUENT ACTION INVOLVING MS. SCHIFF. ALTHOUGH NOT FORMALLY ENJOINED OR BARRED, MS. SCHIFF VOLUNTARILY AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE AG'S PUBLIC PENSION FUND CODE OF CONDUCT AND IS PRECLUDED FROM BEING ENGAGED BY AN INVESTMENT FIRM TO PROVIDE ADVICE, CONSULTING AND/OR MARKETING SERVICES IN CONNECTION WITH POTENTIAL INVESTMENTS BY PUBLIC PENSION FUNDS OTHER THAN AS A PRINCIPAL, SHAREHOLDER OR BONA FIDE EMPLOYEE OF THE INVESTMENT FIRM, WHERE THE ENGAGEMENT INVOLVES DIRECT OR INDIRECT COMMUNICATIONS WITH CERTAIN GOVERNMENT AND/OR PUBLIC PENSION FUND OFFICIALS.

Initiated By: UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: CEASE AND DESIST CENSURE REMEDIAL SANCTIONS DISGORGEMENT UNDERTAKINGS
Allegations: ALLEGATIONS INCLUDED AIDING AND ABETTING VIOLATIONS OF RULE 22C-1 UNDER THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940 BY CERTAIN MUTUAL FUNDS, THE FUNDS' PRINCIPAL UNDERWRITERS, PERSONS DESIGNATED IN THE FUNDS' PROSPECTUSES AS AUTHORIZED TO CONSUMMATE TRANSACTIONS IN THE FUNDS' SECURITIES, OR DEALERS IN THE FUNDS' SECURITIES BETWEEN JANUARY 2001 AND SEPTEMBER 2003.  RULE 22C-1 REQUIRES MUTUAL FUNDS AND THEIR DEALERS TO SELL AND REDEEM FUND SHARES AS A PRICE BASED ON THE CURRENT NAV NEXT COMPUTED AFTER RECEIPT OF AN ORDER TO BUY OR REDEEM.
Other Sanctions Ordered: REMEDIAL SANCTIONS UNDERTAKINGS
Sanction Detail: RITCHIE MULTI-STRATEGY GLOBAL TRADING, LTD. AND RITCHIE CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, L.L.C. WERE ORDERED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000,000 AND INTEREST OF $7,441,967 TO A FAIR FUND FOR DISTRIBUTION TO THE AFFECTED MUTUAL FUNDS.  RITCHIE CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, L.L.C. AND ITS ADVISORY AFFILIATE, A.R. THANE RITCHIE, WERE ORDERED TO PAY A CIVIL  MONEY PENALTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,500,000, AND MR. RITCHIE WAS ORDERED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $1.00.  A FORMER ADVISORY AFFILIATE, WARREN DEMAIO, WAS ORDERED TO PAY A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $250,000 AND DISGORGEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $1.00.
Summary: THIS ACTION WAS SETTLED WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE SEC'S FINDINGS ON FEBRUARY 5, 2008 PURSUANT TO AN ORDER INSTITUTING ADMINISTRATIVE AND CEASE-AND-DESIST PROCEEDINGS, MAKING FINDINGS, AND IMPOSING REMEDIAL SANCTIONS AND A CEASE-AND-DESIST ORDER PURSUANT TO SECTION 8A OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, SECTION 21C OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, SECTIONS 203(E) AND 203(F) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT OF 1940, AND SECTIONS 9(B) AND 9(F) OF THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940.  FURTHER INFORMATION ABOUT THIS SETTLEMENT IS AVAILABLE ON THE SEC'S WEBSITE AT WWW.SEC.GOV.

Initiated By: ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
Other Sanctions: CEASE AND DESIST REMEDIAL SANCTIONS DISGORGEMENT UNDERTAKINGS
Allegations: ALLEGATIONS INCLUDED PLACING MUTUAL FUND TRADE ORDERS BETWEEN JANUARY 2001 AND SEPTEMBER 2003 AFTER THE CLOSE OF THE FINANCIAL MARKETS IN VIOLATION OF ARTICLE 23-A OF THE NEW YORK GENERAL BUSINESS LAW (KNOWN AS THE MARTIN ACT), SECTION 349 OF THE NEW YORK STATE GENERAL BUSINESS LAW AND SECTION 63(12) OF THE NEW YORK STATE EXECUTIVE LAW.
Other Sanctions Ordered: REMEDIAL SANCTIONS UNDERTAKINGS
Sanction Detail: WITHOUT DUPLICATION OF AMOUNTS PAID PURSUANT TO THE SETTLEMENT REACHED WITH THE SEC ON THE SAME DATE, RITCHIE MULTI-STRATEGY GLOBAL TRADING, LTD. AND RITCHIE CAPITAL MANAGEMENT, L.L.C. WERE ORDERED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000,000 AND INTEREST OF $7,441,967 TO A FAIR FUND FOR DISTRIBUTION TO THE AFFECTED MUTUAL FUNDS AND TO PAY A CIVIL  MONEY PENALTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,500,000.
Summary: THIS ACTION WAS SETTLED WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S FINDINGS ON FEBRUARY 5, 2008 PURSUANT TO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE PURSUANT TO NEW YORK STATE EXECUTIVE LAW 63(15).  FURTHER INFORMATION ABOUT THIS SETTLEMENT IS AVAILABLE ON THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S WEBSITE AT WWW.AG.NY.GOV.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Allegations: THE SEC DIVISION OF ENFORCEMENT ALLEGED THAT WARREN LAMMERT VIOLATED CERTAIN PROVISIONS OF THE FEDERAL SECURITIES LAWS BY ALLOWING OR FACILITATING IMPROPER UNDISCLOSED FREQUENT TRADING ARRANGEMENTS AT JANUS CAPITAL MANAGEMENT LLC (JCM), A REGISTERED INVESTMENT ADVISER BASED IN DENVER, COLORADO. THE DIVISION ALLEGED THAT THE FREQUENT TRADING ARRANGEMENTS WERE CONTRARY TO THE PROSPECTUSES GOVERNING THE FUNDS IN WHICH FREQUENT TRADING WAS PERMITTED.    THE DIVISION ALLEGED THAT LAMMERT WILLFULLY VIOLATED, OR, IN THE ALTERNATIVE, WILLFULLY AIDED AND ABETTED AND CAUSED VIOLATIONS OF, SECTION 17(A) OF THE SECURITIES ACT AND SECTION 10(B) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER, AND WILLFULLY AIDED AND ABETTED AND CAUSED VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 206(1) AND 206(2) OF THE ADVISERS ACT; LAMMERT WILLFULLY AIDED AND ABETTED AND CAUSED VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 34(B) OF THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT,  17D-1 THEREUNDER.  THE DIVISION SOUGHT A CEASE-AND-DESIST ORDER, REMEDIAL SANCTIONS, AND CIVIL MONEY PENALTIES.
Sanction Detail: WARREN LAMMERT WAS ORDERED ON MAY 29, 2008 TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS OR FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 17(A)(2) AND 17(A)(3) OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, SECTION 206(2) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS ACT OF 1940, AND SECTION 34(B) OF THE INVESTMENT COMPANY ACT OF 1940.
Summary: THE ADMINISTRATIVE LAW JUDGE OF THE SEC ISSUED AN INITIAL DECISION THAT EXONERATED WARREN LAMMERT OF INTENTIONAL WRONGDOING IN THE MATTER OF FREQUENT TRADING BY OUTSIDE INVESTORS DURING HIS TENURE AT JANUS.  THE ALJ IMPOSED A "CEASE AND DESIST" ORDER FROM FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECURITIES LAWS RELATING TO NEGLIGENCE BUT DENIED OTHER MONETARY FINES AND SANCTIONS SOUGHT BY THE SEC STAFF. THE DECISION IS FINAL: NEITHER THE SEC STAFF/COMMISSION NOR WARREN LAMMERT CHOSE TO ENTER AN APPEALS PROCESS.

Summary: ON JANUARY 8, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. ("BLACKROCK") ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE ("AOD") WITH THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE ("AG") TO SETTLE ALLEGATIONS BY THE AG THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW.  THE AGREEMENT DID NOT INVOLVE THE PAYMENT OF ANY FINE OR OTHER PENALTY.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS AND AGREED TO PAY THE AG $400,000 TOWARDS THE COST OF ITS INVESTIGATION

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN (FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN)
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A SWEDISH ISSUER.
Allegations: THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INC. HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, REPORTS THAT ITS COLLECTIVE OWNERSHIP OF SECURITIES IN THE SWEDISH ISSUER, ASSA ABLOY AB, CROSSED CERTAIN OWNERSHIP THRESHOLDS.
Sanction Detail: FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN IMPOSED A SPECIAL FEE OF 300,000 SEK (APPROXIMATELY $46,300 USD)
Summary: BLACKROCK, INC., PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON JANUARY 27, 2014

Initiated By: U.S. SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: DISGORGEMENT; CIVIL MONEY PENALTY.
Case Number: SEC ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING FILE NO. 3-15132; EXCHANGE ACT RELEASE NO. 68448.
Allegations: 1) BETWEEN 2001 AND 2008, MANAGERS OF AN INDONESIAN JOINT VENTURE MAJORITY-OWNED BY ALLIANZ SE MADE IMPROPER PAYMENTS TO EMPLOYEES OF STATE-OWNED ENTITIES IN INDONESIA; 2) THESE PAYMENTS WERE NOT ACCURATELY REFLECTED IN ALLIANZ SE'S BOOKS AND RECORDS; 3) ALLIANZ SE FAILED TO MAINTAIN A SYSTEM OF INTERNAL CONTROLS REASONABLY DESIGNED TO DETECT AND PREVENT THESE PAYMENTS; 4) AS A RESULT OF THE FOREGOING, ALLIANZ SE VIOLATED SECTIONS 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934.
Resolution: Decision & Order of Offer of Settlement
Other Sanctions Ordered: 1) ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY OF A CEASE AND DESIST ORDER WHICH PROHIBITS FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934; 2) ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $5,315,649 PLUS PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $1,765,125 (TOTAL $7,080,774); 3) AS REFERENCED IN SECTION 12.A. OF THIS DRP, ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF $5,315,649.
Sanction Detail: ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO PAY DISGORGEMENT OF $5,315,649, PREJUDGMENT INTEREST OF $1,765,125, AND A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF $5,315,649 (TOTAL PAYMENT OF $12,396,423).  THE PAYMENT WAS WIRED TO THE SEC ON DECEMBER 20, 2012.
Summary: ON DECEMBER 17, 2012, THE SEC ANNOUNCED THAT IT HAD REACHED A SETTLEMENT WITH ALLIANZ SE TO RESOLVE THE SEC'S INVESTIGATION OF ALLEGED MISCONDUCT AT AN INDONESIAN JOINT VENTURE MAJORITY-OWNED BY ALLIANZ SE.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE SEC'S ALLEGATIONS, ALLIANZ SE CONSENTED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM FURTHER VIOLATIONS OF SECTIONS 13(B)(2)(A) AND 13(B)(2)(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, AND TO PAY APPROXIMATELY $12.4 MILLION IN DISGORGEMENT, PREJUDGMENT INTEREST, AND CIVIL PENALTY.  ALLIANZ SE COOPERATED WITH THE SEC DURING THE COURSE OF ITS INVESTIGATION. FURTHERMORE, FOLLOWING AN INDEPENDENT INTERNAL INVESTIGATION CONDUCTED BY ALLIANZ SE WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF EXTERNAL LEGAL COUNSEL, ALLIANZ SE MODIFIED ITS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO MITIGATE FCPA RISKS.  FOR EXAMPLE, ALLIANZ SE RECENTLY IMPLEMENTED A GROUP-WIDE ANTI-CORRUPTION PROGRAM.

Initiated By: SECURITIES COMMISSION MALAYSIA
Other Sanctions: THE SECURITIES COMMISSION MALAYSIA IN MARCH 2011 ISSUED A DIRECTIVE AGAINST NAVIS MANAGEMENT SDN BHD ("NAVIS MANAGEMENT") TO PUT IN PLACE ALTERNATIVE CLIENT ASSETS PROTECTION MEASURES IN LIEU OF APPOINTING A CUSTODIAN UNDER THE SECURITIES COMMISSION REGULATIONS.
Allegations: NAVIS MANAGEMENT, AN AFFILIATE OF NAVIS CAPITAL PARTNERS LTD, PROVIDES SUB-ADVISORY SERVICES TO NAVIS MANAGED PRIVATE FUNDS AND IS REGULATED AS A FUND MANAGEMENT COMPANY BY SECURITIES COMMISSION MALAYSIA.  IN ACCORDANCE WITH CERTAIN DIRECTIVES OF SECURITIES COMMISSION MALAYSIA DATED MARCH 2011, NAVIS MANAGEMENT, IN LIEU OF APPOINTING A CUSTODIAN TO HOLD THE ASSETS THAT SUCH PRIVATE FUNDS INVESTS IN AS REFERRED TO IN SECTION 122(1) OF THE MALAYSIAN CAPITAL MARKETS AND SERVICES ACT 2007, HAS PUT IN PLACE ALTERNATIVE MEASURES TO SAFEGUARD THE INTERESTS OF NAVIS FUND INVESTORS IN SUCH ASSETS. AS DIRECTED BY SECURITIES COMMISSION MALAYSIA, SUCH ALTERNATIVE MEASURES INCLUDE A REVIEW AND RECONCILIATION BY AN AUDITOR OF THE LEGAL AND ECONOMIC OWNERSHIP OF THE ASSETS OF SUCH PRIVATE FUNDS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

JM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES LIMITED (FORMERLY KNOWN AS M FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES PRIVATE LIMITED) ALONG WITH OTHER LEAD MANAGERS FOR ALLEGED DEFICIENCY IN DUE DILIGENCE WITH REFERENCE TO DISCLOSURES MADE IN OFFER DOCUMENTS OF THE ISSUER COMPANIES AND MARKET PRACTICES WITH RESPECT TO THE BIDDING PROCESS.
Other Sanctions Ordered: NOT APPLICABLE

Summary: PURSUANT TO THE INSPECTION REPORT OF MARCH 13, 2006 SEBI HAD ISSUED ITS OBSERVATIONS ON THE ALLEGED DEFICIENCY IN DUE DILIGENCE WITH REFERENCE TO DISCLOSURES MADE IN THE OFFER DOCUMENTS OF THE ISSUER COMPANIES AND MARKET PRACTICES WITH RESPECT TO THE BIDDING PROCESS. JM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES LIMITED (FORMERLY KNOWN AS M FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES PRIVATE LIMITED)HAD FROM TIME TO TIME GIVEN ITS RESPONSES TO THE ABOVE OBSERVATIONS. SUBSEQUENTLY A SHOW CAUSE NOTICE ISSUED BY SEBI IN THE SAID MATTER. IN ORDER TO BRING QUIETUS TO THIS MATTER AND AVOID LITIGATION COSTS,JM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES LIMITED (FORMERLY KNOWN AS M FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES PRIVATE LIMITED) HAD THEN PREFERRED A CONSENT APPLICATION. THE CONSENT TERMS PROPOSED BY JM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES LIMITED (FORMERLY KNOWN AS M FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES PRIVATE LIMITED) ,WERE EXAMINED BY THE HIGH POWERED ADVISORY COMMITTEE OF SEBI AND SEBI HAD VIDE ITS ORDER DATED AUGUST 25, 2009 AGREED FOR SETTLEMENT WITHOUT JM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES LIMITED (FORMERLY KNOWN AS M FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES PRIVATE LIMITED) ADMITTING OR DENYING THE GUILT AND DISPOSED OF THE ADJUDICATION PROCEEDINGS INITIATED AGAINST JM FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES LIMITED (FORMERLY KNOWN AS M FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONAL SECURITIES PRIVATE LIMITED).

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
Date Initiated Explanation: MAY 27 2009 INITIAL ENQUIRY FROM THE SEC REF: HO 11071 MAY 5 2010 CEASE AND DESIST PROCEEDING REF: ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING FILE NUMBER 3-14202
Allegations: RULE 105 OF REGULATION M:   IN OCTOBER OF 2007 HCM'S  EUROPEAN FUNDS INITIATED A STRATEGIC SHORT POSITION IN MERRILL LYNCH COMMON SHARES. BETWEEN OCTOBER 2007 AND JULY 2008 THE TOTAL ASSETS MANAGED BY THE EUROPEAN FUNDS INCREASED FROM $193 MILLION TO $1,282 MILLION. CONSEQUENTLY, IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE FUND'S STRATEGIC SHORT EXPOSURE TO MERRILL LYNCH, THE NUMBER OF COMMON SHARES SHORTED WAS GRADUALLY INCREASED FROM 25,000 IN OCTOBER 2007 TO 673,500 IN EARLY JULY 2008. ON THE 23RD OF JULY 2008 THE EUROPEAN FUNDS SHORTED A FURTHER 75,000 COMMON SHARES OF MERRILL LYNCH, INCREASING ITS TOTAL SHORT EXPOSURE TO 748,500 SHARES.   FOUR BUSINESS DAYS LATER IN AN UNEXPECTED SECONDARY OFFERING, ON THE 29TH OF JULY 2008, MERRILL LYNCH SOLD APPROXIMATELY 365,500,000 COMMON SHARES, EQUIVALENT TO ABOUT $8.5BN. HCM, LEGITIMATELY UNDER UK FSA REGULATIONS, USED THIS PLACING TO COVER A PORTION OF THE STRATEGIC SHORT EXPOSURE, WHIST BEING AT THE TIME UNAWARE THAT IN-SO-DOING HCM WERE IN BREACH OF USA SEC RULE 105.  AFTER HORSEMAN CAPITAL MANAGEMENT LTD ("HCM") LEARNED THAT SEC RULE 105 HAD BEEN VIOLATED, HCM DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED POLICIES PROCEDURES AND TRAINING PROGRAMMES PERTAINING TO RULE 105 COMPLIANCE.
Sanction Detail: DISGORGEMENT OF USD 1,295,138 PRE-JUDGEMENT INTEREST OF USD 124,814 CIVIL PENALTY OF USD 65,000
Summary: HORSEMAN CAPITAL MANAGEMENT ("HCM")  AGREED ON A SETTLEMENT TO AN ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION (SEC) REGARDING A JULY 2008 BREACH OF SEC RULE 105. IN OCTOBER OF 2007 HCM'S  EUROPEAN FUNDS INITIATED A STRATEGIC SHORT POSITION IN MERRILL LYNCH COMMON SHARES. BETWEEN OCTOBER 2007 AND JULY 2008 THE TOTAL ASSETS MANAGED BY THE EUROPEAN FUND INCREASED FROM $193 MILLION TO $1,282 MILLION. CONSEQUENTLY, IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN THE FUND'S STRATEGIC SHORT EXPOSURE TO MERRILL LYNCH, THE NUMBER OF COMMON SHARES SHORTED WAS GRADUALLY INCREASED FROM 25,000 IN OCTOBER 2007 TO 673,500 IN EARLY JULY 2008. ON THE 23RD OF JULY 2008 THE EUROPEAN FUND SHORTED A FURTHER 75,000 COMMON SHARES OF MERRILL LYNCH, INCREASING ITS TOTAL SHORT EXPOSURE TO 748,500 SHARES.   FOUR BUSINESS DAYS LATER IN AN UNEXPECTED SECONDARY OFFERING, ON THE 29TH OF JULY 2008, MERRILL LYNCH SOLD APPROXIMATELY 365,500,000 COMMON SHARES, EQUIVALENT TO ABOUT $8.5BN. HCM, LEGITIMATELY UNDER UK FSA REGULATIONS, USED THIS PLACING TO COVER A PORTION OF THE STRATEGIC SHORT EXPOSURE, WHIST BEING AT THE TIME UNAWARE THAT IN-SO-DOING HCM WERE IN BREACH OF USA SEC RULE 105.  BY PARTICIPATING IN THE SECONDARY OFFERING THE FUNDS OBTAINED A BENEFIT. THE DISGORGEMENT OF THIS BENEFIT HAS BEEN DULY PAID.

Initiated By: KOREAN FINANCIAL SERVICES COMMISSION
Date Initiated Explanation: ON MAY 11, 2015, COUNSEL ADVISED ORBIS THAT THE KOREAN FINANCIAL SERVICES COMMISSION ("FSC") MAY ISSUE AN ADMINISTRATIVE FINE DUE TO ORBIS' LATE REPORTING THAT IT HELD MORE THAN 4% OF THE TOTAL OUTSTANDING VOTING SHARES OF A BANK HOLDING COMPANY, A NOTIFICATION REQUIRED UNDER ARTICLE 8(2)1 OF THE FINANCIAL HOLDING COMPANIES ACT ("FHCA") AND ARTICLE 6-2(3)1 OF THE FHCA'S PRESIDENTIAL DECREE. ON JUNE 4, 2015, COUNSEL ADVISED ORBIS THAT THE FSC INDICATED THAT IT WOULD IMPOSE THIS ADMINISTRATIVE FINE.
Allegations: ORBIS UNINTENTIONALLY FAILED TO TIMELY REPORT TO THE KOREAN FINANCIAL SERVICES COMMISSION (FSC") THAT THE ORBIS FUNDS HELD IN EXCESS OF 4% OF THE TOTAL OUTSTANDING VOTING SHARES OF A KOREAN BANK HOLDING COMPANY. UPON REALIZING THIS OMISSION, ORBIS PROMPTLY MADE THE REQUIRED FILING.   ON AUGUST 12, 2015, ORBIS, THROUGH ITS LEGAL COUNSEL, PAID AN ADMINISTRATIVE FINE OF KRW2,080,000 TO RESOLVE THE MATTER, WHICH WAS EQUIVALENT TO LESS THAN US$1,800 AT EXCHANGE RATES AS OF THAT DATE.
Sanction Detail: ORBIS INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT LIMITED, THROUGH ITS LEGAL COUNSEL, PAID AN ADMINISTRATIVE FINE OF KRW2,080,000 ON AUGUST 12, 2015 TO RESOLVE THE ABOVE-MENTIONED LATE FILING, WHICH WAS EQUIVALENT TO LESS THAN US$1,800 AT EXCHANGE RATES AS OF THAT DATE. NO OTHER ENTITY PAID THE ADMINISTRATIVE FINE AND NO PORTION OF THE PENALTY WAS WAIVED.
Summary: ON AUGUST 12, 2015, ORBIS, THROUGH ITS COUNSEL, PAID AN ADMINISTRATIVE FINE OF KRW2,080,000 TO RESOLVE THE ABOVE-MENTIONED LATE FILING, WHICH WAS EQUIVALENT TO LESS THAN US$1,800 AT EXCHANGE RATES AS OF THAT DATE.

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA ("CONSOB")
Allegations: BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED ("BIMUK") ON BEHALF OF THE BLACKROCK GROUP OF COMPANIES MADE AN INCORRECT LARGE  SHAREHOLDER THRESHOLD FILING TO CONSOB IN DECEMBER 2011 REGARDING ITS HOLDINGS IN UNICREDIT S.P.A., ON BEHALF OF CLIENTS.  BLACKROCK DETECTED THIS ERROR, SELF-REPORTED IT TO CONSOB AND INFORMED THE MARKET OF THIS MISTAKE BACK IN JANUARY 2012.
Sanction Detail: CONSOB IMPOSED A FINE OF 150,000 EURO FOR NEGLIGENT MARKET MANIPULATION (APPROXIMATELY $205,826 USD). THE FINE WAS PAID ON MAY 8, 2014.
Summary: ON APRIL 29, 2014, CONSOB FINED BIMUK 150,000 EURO (APPROXIMATELY $205,826 USD)ON THE BASIS OF NEGLIGENT MARKET MANIPULATION ARISING FROM ITS INCORRECT LARGE SHAREHOLDER REPORT IN DECEMBER 2011.

Initiated By: HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION
Other Sanctions: 3,000 EUROS
Date Initiated Explanation: THE DECISION OF THE REGULATOR WAS FIRST FORWARDED TO BLACKROCK IN MARCH 2010
Allegations: IN 2006 MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT LTD. DID NOT TIMELY FILE A REQUIRED DISCLOSURE WITH THE HELLENIC REPUBLIC CAPITAL MARKET COMMISSION REGARDING ITS PERCENTAGE OF TOTAL VOTING RIGHTS IN A CERTAIN GREEK-BASED COMPANY CHANGING FROM 5.01% TO 4.98% THE CIRCUMSTANCES GIVING RISE TO THIS MATTER OCCURRED PRIOR TO BLACKROCK ACQUIRING MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENTS MANAGEMENT LTD.
Other Sanctions Ordered: PAYMENT OF FINE IN EUROS.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF 3,000 EUROS.
Summary: VIOLATION CHARGE INCURRED DUE TO LATE DISCLOSURE NOTIFICATION.

Initiated By: UNITED KINGDOM - FINANCIAL SERVICES AUTHORITY (FSA)
Allegations: BETWEEN OCTOBER 1, 2006 AND MARCH 31, 2010, BIMUK FAILED TO PUT TRUST LETTERS IN PLACE IN RELATION TO SOME OF THE MONEY MARKET DEPOSITS IT PLACED WITH THIRD PARTY BANKS.  THE ERROR OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF SYSTEMS CHANGES THAT FOLLOWED BLACKROCK GROUP'S ACQUISITION OF BIMUK, WHICH HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN KNOWN AS MERRILL LYNCH INVESTMENT MANAGERS LIMITED.  THESE CHANGES RENDERED BIMUK'S PROCEDURES FOR SETTING UP TRUST LETTERS INNEFFECTIVE.
Sanction Detail: THE FSA HAS FINED BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED 9,533,100 POUNDS STERLING (APPROXIMATELY $15,322,551)
Summary: IN DETERMINING THE FINE THE FSA TOOK INTO ACCOUNT THAT THE MISCONDUCT WAS NOT DELIBERATE, AND THAT BIMUK SELF-REPORTED THE ISSUE TO THE FSA AND HAS SINCE REMEDIED THE SITUATION AND PUT IN PLACE ROBUST SYSTEMS AND CONTROLS RELATIVE TO THE PROCESS OF TRUST LETTERS FOR MONEY MARKET DEPOSITS PLACED WITH THIRD PARTY BANKS RELATING TO CLIENT MONEY PROTECTION. NO CLIENTS SUFFERED ANY LOSSES AS A RESULT OF THIS ERROR.  THE FINE HAS BEEN PAID TO THE FSA.

Initiated By: BUNDESANSTALT FR FINANZDIENSTLEISTUNGSAUFSICHT ("BAFIN")
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN SHARES OF ISSUERS WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMANY ("GERMAN ISSUERS")
Allegations: BAFIN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED ("BIM UK"), AS FILING AGENT FOR CERTAIN OF ITS AFFILIATES, HAD MADE INCORRECT OR LATE REPORTS IN CONTRAVENTION OF GERMAN THRESHOLDS REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.
Sanction Detail: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 3.25 MILLION EUROS AGAINST BIM UK.  AN ADDITIONAL 7,500 EUROS WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT OF AN ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGE.
Summary: IN 2014, BIM UK SELF-REPORTED TO BAFIN THAT CERTAIN DISCLOSURES WERE EITHER INCORRECT OR LATE. BIM UK WORKED CLOSELY WITH BAFIN TO REMEDY THE RELEVANT DISCLOSURES AND INFORMED THE APPROPRIATE ISSUERS, AND THE BROADER MARKET, ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2014.  ON MARCH 20, 2015, BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 3.25 MILLION EUROS AGAINST BIM UK.  AN ADDITIONAL        7,500 EUROS WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT OF AN ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGE. BIM UK PAID THE FINE AND ADMINISTRATION CHARGE TOTALING  3,257,500 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $3,563,216 USD) ON MARCH 26, 2015.

Initiated By: FINANSSIVALVONTA - THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF FINLAND
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A FINNISH ISSUER.
Allegations: ON SEPTEMBER 12, 2013, BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF FINLAND ("FINNISH FSA") THAT BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, A NOTIFICATION THAT THE INDIRECT AGGREGATE SHAREHOLDING IN A FINNISH ISSUER, OUTOTEC OYJ, CROSSED A CERTAIN THRESHOLD ("LATE NOTIFICATION").
Other Sanctions Ordered: THE FINNISH FSA ISSUED A PUBLIC REPRIMAND TO BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED.
Sanction Detail: ON JUNE 5, 2015, THE FINNISH FSA ISSUED A PUBLIC REPRIMAND TO BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED BECAUSE OF THE LATE NOTIFICATION.
Summary: BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED IS NOT APPEALING THE DECISION AND CONSIDERS THE MATTER CLOSED.

Initiated By: BAFIN (THE GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY)
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A GERMAN ISSUERS
Allegations: THE BAFIN ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED, AS AGENT FOR CERTAIN OF ITS ADVISORY AFFILIATES, HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE REQUIRED TIME PERIOD, REPORTS THAT THE COLLECTIVE OWNERSHIP OF SECURITIES IN GERMAN ISSUERS CROSSED CERTAIN OWNERSHIP THRESHOLDS
Sanction Detail: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 220,000 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $299,488).  AN ADDITIONAL 7,500 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $10,209) WAS LEVIED IN RESPECT FOR THE ASSOCIATED ADMINISTRATION CHARGES.
Summary: BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED PAID THE FINE AND ADMINISTRATION CHARGES TOTALING 227,500 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $309,697) ON JANUARY 9, 2014.

Initiated By: BAFIN, GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY
Allegations: AN ENTITY IS REQUIRED TO FILE A NOTIFICATION ("NOTIFICATION FILING") WHEN ITS SHAREHOLDINGS OF A SECURITY, WHOSE HOME COUNTRY IS THE FEDERAL REPUBLIC OF GERMAN, REACH, EXCEED OR FALL BELOW PRESCRIBED LIMITS ("THRESHOLD LIMITS").  WHEN THE THRESHOLD LIMITS ARE REACHED, NOTIFICATION FILINGS ARE TO BE FILLED WITH THE GERMAN FEDERAL FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY ("BAFIN") AND ISSUER OF THE SECURITY WITHIN A SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD.  WHILE BLACKROCK ("BLACKROCK, INC. AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES") FILED THE NOTIFICATION FILINGS FOR CERTAIN SECURITIES, THE FILINGS WERE NOT COMPLETED WITHIN THE REQUIRED TIME PERIOD.
Sanction Detail: PAYMENT OF FINE 167,503.50 EUROS
Summary: BAFIN IMPOSED A FINE OF 167,503.50 EUROS (APPROXIMATELY $ 238,386 AS OF JUNE 18, 2012) FOR BLACKROCK BEING IN CONTRAVENTION OF THE REQUIREMENT TO FILE NOTIFICATION FILINGS WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME.  BLACKROCK HAS AGREED TO PAY THE FINE.

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN - THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN
Other Product: INVESTMENT IN EQUITY SECURITIES OF A SWEDISH ISSUER.
Allegations: ON OCTOBER 31, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN ("SWEDISH FSA") THAT BLACKROCK, INC. HAD NOT FILED, WITHIN THE SPECIFIED TIME PERIOD, A NOTIFICATION THAT ITS INDIRECT AGGREGATE SHAREHOLDING IN A SWEDISH ISSUER, ASSA ABLOY AB, CROSSED A CERTAIN THRESHOLD ("LATE NOTIFICATION").
Sanction Detail: AS A RESULT OF THE LATE NOTIFICATION, THE SWEDISH FSA NOTIFIED BLACKROCK, INC., IN A LETTER DATED APRIL 29, 2015, OF ITS DECISION TO IMPOSE A PENALTY FEE OF SEK 1,000,000 (APPROXIMATELY $120,700 USD). BLACKROCK, INC. PAID THE PENALTY FEE ON JUNE 10, 2015.
Summary: THE PENALTY FEE, INVOICE DATE MAY 29, 2015, WAS PAID ON JUNE 10, 2015

Initiated By: NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL ("AG")
Allegations: THE AG ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF CERTAIN ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW
Other Sanctions Ordered: AGREEMENT OF DISCONTINUANCE
Sanction Detail: BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS.
Summary: ON JANUARY 8, 2014, BLACKROCK, INC. ("BLACKROCK") ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE ("AOD") WITH THE NEW YORK ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE ("AG") TO SETTLE ALLEGATIONS BY THE AG THAT BLACKROCK'S USE OF ANALYST SURVEYS VIOLATED NEW YORK'S MARTIN ACT AND EXECUTIVE LAW.  THE AGREEMENT DID NOT INVOLVE THE PAYMENT OF ANY FINE OR OTHER PENALTY.  WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BLACKROCK AGREED TO STOP USING ANALYST SURVEYS AND AGREED TO PAY THE AG $400,000 TOWARDS THE COST OF ITS INVESTIGATION.

Initiated By: FINANSINSPEKTIONEN (SWEDISH FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY (THE "SFSA")
Allegations: THE FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN (THE "SFSA") ALLEGED THAT BLACKROCK, INC. VIOLATED LOCAL SWEDISH LAW BY NOT FILING IN SWEDEN, WITHIN A PRESCRIBED TIME, REPORTS THAT ITS COLLECTIVE SHAREHOLDINGS IN LUNDIN MINING CORPORATION (A CANADIAN COMPANY WITH A PRIMARY LISTING ON TORONTO STOCK EXCHANGE AND A LISTING OF SWEDISH DEPOSITARY RECEIPTS ON NASDAQ OMX STOCKHOLM) CROSSED CERTAIN OWNERSHIP THRESHOLDS.
Sanction Detail: FINANCIAL SUPERVISORY AUTHORITY OF SWEDEN IMPOSED A SPECIAL FEE OF 1,000,000 SEK (APPROXIMATELY $138,200 USD). BLACKROCK, INC. PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON OCTOBER 15, 2014.
Summary: BLACKROCK, INC. PAID THE SPECIAL FEE ON OCTOBER 15, 2014

Initiated By: COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA
Allegations: THE ITALIAN SECURITIES REGULATOR, COMMISSIONE NAZIONALE PER LE SOCIETA E LA BORSA ("CONSOB"), INITIATED A CIVIL PROCEEDING ON JANUARY 3, 2014 AGAINST NIGEL BOLTON, A PORTFOLIO MANAGER AND HEAD OF BLACKROCK INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT (UK) LIMITED'S ("BLACKROCK") EUROPEAN EQUITY TEAM ("EET"), IN CONNECTION WITH THE SALE OF SHARES IN THE ITALIAN OIL AND GAS SERVICES COMPANY SAIPEM, SPA IN JANUARY 2013.   CONSOB ALLEGES THAT MR. BOLTON, ON BEHALF OF CERTAIN BLACKROCK CLIENTS, SOLD, OR INFLUENCED THE SALE OF, APPROXIMATELY 10.7 MILLION SHARES OF SAIPEM USING MATERIAL, NON-PUBLIC INFORMATION THEREBY AVOIDING CLIENT LOSSES OF OVER 114.5 MILLION EUROS. WHILE BLACKROCK IS NOT CHARGED IN THE PROCEEDING, IT MAY BE LIABLE FOR THE ACTIONS OF MR. BOLTON.
Summary: BLACKROCK CONDUCTED A THOROUGH INVESTIGATION AND FOUND NO EVIDENCE TO SUPPORT THE ALLEGATIONS. AS A RESULT OF THE INVESTIGATION, BLACKROCK BELIEVES THAT THE SALE OF SAIPEM SHARES WAS MADE AS A FIDUCIARY BASED ON PUBLICLY AVAILABLE INFORMATION THAT WAS WIDELY DISSEMINATED IN THE MARKETPLACE, INCLUDING NEGATIVE PUBLICITY AND A THIRD-PARTY ANALYST RESEARCH REPORT REDUCING EARNINGS ESTIMATES, WHICH WAS ISSUED TO THE MARKET BEFORE TRADING ON JANUARY 25, 2013. INSIDER TRADING IS ABHORRENT TO BLACKROCK'S VALUES, AND BLACKROCK DOES NOT TOLERATE IT.  WHILE UNDER ITALIAN LAW THE POTENTIAL PENALTY COULD BE GREATER THAN THE LOSS ACTUALLY AVOIDED, BLACKROCK BELIEVES THAT MR. BOLTON WILL NOT BE FOUND LIABLE AND, AS A RESULT, NEITHER MR. BOLTON NOR BLACKROCK WILL INCUR ANY PENALTY. NONE OF BLACKROCK'S CLIENTS OR ANY OF THE FUNDS MANAGED BY BLACKROCK WILL BE AFFECTED BY THESE PROCEEDINGS.

Initiated By: ATTORNEY GENERAL FOR THE STATE OF NEW YORK
Date Initiated Explanation: THE NY AG COMMENCED ITS INDUSTRY-WIDE INVESTIGATION THAT LED TO THE ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE (EACH DISCUSSED BELOW) IN MARCH OF 2007. WETHERLY (AS DEFINED BELOW) WAS FIRST CONTACT IN EARLY 2009.
Employing Firm: WETHERLY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC AND DAV/WETHERLY FINANCIAL, L.P. (COLLECTIVELY, "WETHERLY")
Other Product: PRIVATE FUND INVESTMENTS BY PUBLIC PENSION PLANS
Allegations: IN 3/2007, THE NY AG COMMENCED AN INDUSTRY-WIDE INVESTIGATION INTO, AMONG OTHER THINGS, ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND CORRUPTION INVOLVING INVESTMENT FIRMS' USE OF PLACEMENT AGENTS TO OBTAIN INVESTMENTS FROM PUBLIC PENSION PLANS. THE WETHERLY INVESTIGATION FOCUSED PRIMARILY ON CERTAIN SUB-AGENTS USED BY WETHERLY W/R/T THE NY CRF.  IN FEBRUARY, 2010, WETHERLY AND THE NY AG'S OFFICE ENTERED INTO AN ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE PURSUANT TO WHICH MS. SCHIFF (WHO WAS NOT PERSONALLY SUBJECT OF THE INVESTIGATION) AGREED TO REFRAIN FROM BEING ENGAGED BY AN INVESTMENT FIRM TO ADVISE ANY PUBLIC PENSION FUND, OTHER THAN WHEN ACTING AS A PRINCIPAL, SHAREHOLDER OR EMPLOYEE OF THE ENGAGING FIRM.
Resolution Date Explanation: THE RESOLUTION INVOLVED THE ASSURANCE OF DISCONTINUANCE
Other Sanctions Ordered: MS. SCHIFF WAS NOT PERSONALLY THE SUBJECT OF THE NY AG'S INVESTIGATION, BUT AGREED TO BE BOUND BY THE AG'S PUBLIC PENSION FUND CODE OF CONDUCT AND REFRAIN FROM THE ACTIVITIES DISCUSSED BELOW.
Sanction Detail: IN AGREEING TO BE BOUND BY THE AG'S PUBLIC PENSION FUND CODE OF CONDUCT, MS. SCHIFF AGREED TO THE PRECLUSION DISCUSSED BELOW COMMENCING IN FEBRUARY, 2010.
Summary: THIS ACTION WAS CONCLUDED IN FEBRUARY 2010, AND THERE HAS BEEN NO SUBSEQUENT ACTION INVOLVING MS. SCHIFF. ALTHOUGH NOT FORMALLY ENJOINED OR BARRED, MS. SCHIFF VOLUNTARILY AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE AG'S PUBLIC PENSION FUND CODE OF CONDUCT AND IS PRECLUDED FROM BEING ENGAGED BY AN INVESTMENT FIRM TO PROVIDE ADVICE, CONSULTING AND/OR MARKETING SERVICES IN CONNECTION WITH POTENTIAL INVESTMENTS BY PUBLIC PENSION FUNDS OTHER THAN AS A PRINCIPAL, SHAREHOLDER OR BONA FIDE EMPLOYEE OF THE INVESTMENT FIRM, WHERE THE ENGAGEMENT INVOLVES DIRECT OR INDIRECT COMMUNICATIONS WITH CERTAIN GOVERNMENT AND/OR PUBLIC PENSION FUND OFFICIALS.

Initiated By: SWEDISH FINANCIAL AUTHORITY ("SFSA")
Date Initiated Explanation: ON 02/19/2015, THE SFSA SENT THE REGISTRANT'S CLIENT (THE "CLIENT") CORRESPONDENCE ADDRESSING A POTENTIAL VIOLATION OF EUROPEAN UNION SHORT SELLING RULES. THE REGISTRANT REPLIED ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENT. ON 05/11/2015, THE SFSA CONFIRMED VIA LETTER TO THE CLIENT THAT THE SFSA DECIDED TO IMPOSE FINES OF SEK 20,000 (US $ 2,364) ON THE CLIENT FOR VIOLATIONS OF EU SHORT SELLING RULES. THE DATE INDICATED IN RESPONSE TO QUESTION 3 IS THE DATE ON WHICH THE SFSA DECIDED TO IMPOSE FINES ON THE CLIENT.
Allegations: IN AUGUST 2014, THE REGISTRANT NOTIFIED THE SFSA OF NET SHORT POSITIONS IN THE SHARES OF A SWEDISH ISSUER. THAT NOTIFICATION WAS UNINTENTIONALLY MADE LATER THAN THE NEXT-DAY NOTIFICATION DEADLINE SPECIFIED IN REGULATION (EU) NO. 236/2012.
Sanction Detail: $2,364 WAS PAID BY THE REGISTRANT ON 08/31/2015 PURSUANT TO THE INVOICE ISSUED BY THE SFSA. NO PORTION OF THE PENALTY WAS WAIVED.
Summary: ON 02/19/2015, THE SFSA SENT THE CLIENT CORRESPONDENCE ADDRESSING A POTENTIAL VIOLATION OF EUROPEAN UNION SHORT SELLING RULES FOR FAILING TO TIMELY REPORT A SHORT NET POSITION.  THE REGISTRANT REPLIED ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENT, EXPLAINING THE NOTIFICATION WAS UNINTENTIONALLY MADE LATER THAN THE REQUIRED NEXT-DAY NOTIFICATION DEADLINE AS THE RESULT OF INADVERTENT ERROR AND A CANADIAN CIVIC HOLIDAY. ON 05/11/2015, THE SFSA NOTIFIED VIA LETTER TO THE CLIENT THAT THE SFSA DECIDED TO IMPOSE FINES OF US$2,364. THE REGISTRANT HAS PAID THE FINE PURSUANT TO THE INVOICE ISSUED BY THE SFSA.

Initiated By: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE BOARD OF INDIA
Other Sanctions: DISAPPROVAL OF CONDITIONAL PERMISSION TO TRADE IN LOCAL INDIAN SECURITIES
Other Product: SUB-FUND OF A LUXEMBOURG UMBRELLA SICAV
Allegations: THE FUND CI EMERGING ASIA EQUITY (CIEAE) WAS LAUNCHED ON 29 MARCH 2011 WITH SEED MONEY FROM THE INVESTMENT ADVISER'S PARENT COMPANY. APPLICATION FOR PERMISSION TO TRADE FOR CIEAE IN LOCAL INDIAN SHARES WAS APPROVED BY SEBI SUBJECT TO CIEAE OBTAINING BROAD BASED STATUS (I.E. SUFFICIENT DIVERSIFICATION OF INVESTOR BASE) WITHIN 6 MONTHS, I.E. BY END OF MAY 2011. REQUEST FOR EXTENSION OF PERIOD TO MEET BROAD BASED STATUS REJECTED BY SEBI BY LETTER DATED 25 MAY 2011, DESPITE THE FACT THAT CIEAE WAS ON THE VERGE OF MEETING CRITERIA (WHICH IN FACT HAPPENED AS OF 3 JUNE 2011).
Other Sanctions Ordered: SEBI REQUIRED CAPITAL INTERNATIONAL PORTFOLIO TO SURRENDER THE CONDITIONAL APPROVAL FOR CIEAE TO TRADE IN LOCAL INDIAN SECURITIES AND TO REQUEST SEBI'S APPROVAL TO DISINVEST FROM LOCAL INDIAN SECURITIES HELD IN CIEAE.
Sanction Detail: SEBI LETTER OF 26 JULY 2011 ACKNOWLEDGING CAPITAL INTERNATIONAL PORTFOLIOS' LETTER OF 6 JULY 2011 AND GRANTING PERMISSION TO DISINVEST FROM LOCAL INDIAN SECURITIES WITHIN SIX MONTHS FROM 26 JULY 2011 LETTER, AND TO CONFIRM BACK TO SEBI ONCE DISINVESTMENT COMPLETED.
Summary: PURSUANT TO SEBI'S LETTER OF 26 JULY 2011, ALL LOCAL INDIAN SECURITIES HELD IN CIEAE'S PORTFOLIO WERE SOLD BY 12 SEPTEMBER 2011. THE SAME WAS CONFIRMED TO SEBI BY LETTER DATED 16 SEPTEMBER 2011, AND THE SAME LETTER CONFIRMED CAPITAL INTERNATIONAL PORTFOLIO'S SURRENDER OF PERMISSION TO TRADE IN LOCAL INDIAN SECURITIES FOR CIEAE. SEBI CONFIRMED RECEIPT AND ACKNOWLEDGED SURRENDER OF SUCH PERMISSION IN A LETTER DATED 21 OCTOBER 2011.   ON 11 MAY 2012 APPLICATION FOR PERMISSION TO TRADE FOR CIEAE IN LOCAL INDIAN SHARES WAS SUBMITTED TO THE SEBI.  ON 12 JUNE 2012 PERMISSION TO TRADE FOR CIEAE IN LOCAL INDIAN SHARES WAS APPROVED BY THE SEBI.  ON 22 JULY 2014 CIEAE WAS FULLY LIQUIDATED.

Initiated By: THE PANEL ON TAKEOVERS AND MERGERS
Other Sanctions: STATEMENT OF CRITICISM OF N M ROTHSCHILD & SONS LIMITED
Allegations: N M ROTHSCHILD & SONS LIMITED ("NMR") WAS PUBLICLY CRITICISED BY THE PANEL EXECUTIVE FOR FAILING TO PREVENT BREACHES OF RULES 9.1 AND 7.1 OF THE TAKEOVER CODE IN CONNECTION WITH THE PURCHASE OF SHARES IN PLUSNET ON BEHALF OF BT ON 21 NOVEMBER 2006.  NMR WAS FINANCIAL ADVISER TO BT AND FAILED TO ADVISE OF THE 30% THRESHOLD TRIGGER.
Other Sanctions Ordered: PUBLIC CRITICISM OF N M ROTHSCHILD & SONS LIMITED.
Sanction Detail: N M ROTHSCHILD & SONS WERE PERMITTED TO REMEDY THE BREACH OF RULE 9 BY SELLING SUFFICIENT SHARES TO BRING THE HOLDING DOWN TO BELOW 30%.  N M ROTHSCHILD &SONS BORE THE LOSS OF THE SALE OF THOSE SHARES.
Summary: THE MATTER IS CLOSED.

Initiated By: NEW ZEALAND FINANCIAL MARKETS AUTHORITY (FMA)
Other Sanctions: FMA IS SEEKING DECLARATION THAT ARCHER CAPITAL BREACHED THE SUBSTANTIAL SHAREHOLDER NOTIFICATION AND PECUNIARY PENALTY IN AMOUNT DETERMINED BY COURT. MAXIMUM AMOUNT IS NZ$1,000,000 (S42WSMA)
Allegations: ARCHER CAPITAL ISSUED A SUBSTANTIAL SHAREHOLDER NOTICE (SSN) FOLLOWING AGREEMENT BEING EXECUTED FOR A TRANSACTION WHICH DID NOT PROCEED. FMA ALLEGE THAT ARCHER CAPITAL OBTAINED RELEVANT INTEREST IN SECURITIES AT SOME POINT PRIOR TO DATE OF SSN AND THEREFORE HAD NOT MADE THE NOTIFICATION IN A TIMELY MANNER.
Summary: STATEMENT OF CLAIM AND DEFENCE HAVE BEEN FILED. EVIDENCE IS TO BE SERVED IN APRIL 2016 (BY PLAINTIFF) AND JUNE 2016 (BY DEFENDANT). THE HEARING IS LISTED FOR 1 AUGUST 2016.

Initiated By: AUSTRALIAN SECURITIES AND INVESTMENTS COMMISSION ("ASIC")
Date Initiated Explanation: UNABLE TO COMPLETE EXACT DATE AS THE TIMING OF ANY REGULATORY ACTION IS NOT CERTAIN.
Allegations: IN THE INTERESTS OF FULL DISCLOSURE, WE WISH TO INFORM YOU THAT REGAL FUNDS MANAGEMENT PTY LIMITED (REGAL) HAS BECOME AWARE THAT THE AUSTRALIAN SECURITIES AND INVESTMENTS COMMISSION (ASIC) IS CONDUCTING A HEARING OF A CIVIL NATURE UNDER THE CORPORATIONS ACT INTO THE CONDUCT OF REGAL'S CHIEF INVESTMENT OFFICER. THE SUBJECT MATTER CONCERNS A PARTICULAR TRADING EVENT IN 2013. REGAL'S CHIEF INVESTMENT OFFICER IS COOPERATING FULLY WITH ASIC'S INVESTIGATION. HE STRONGLY DENIES ANY LAWS OR REGULATIONS HAVE BEEN BREACHED AND BELIEVES HE WILL BE CLEARED OF ANY WRONGDOING. HE CONTINUES TO ACT AS PORTFOLIO MANAGER AND TO MAKE INVESTMENTS ON BEHALF OF THE FUND.
Summary: THE CURRENT STATUS OF THE HEARING WHICH IS BEING CONDUCTED BY ASIC IS PENDING. THE SUBJECT MATTER CONCERNS A PARTICULAR TRADING EVENT IN 2013. REGAL'S CHIEF INVESTMENT OFFICER IS COOPERATING FULLY WITH ASIC'S INVESTIGATION. HE STRONGLY DENIES ANY LAWS OR REGULATIONS HAVE BEEN BREACHED AND BELIEVES HE WILL BE CLEARED OF ANY WRONGDOING. HE CONTINUES TO ACT AS PORTFOLIO MANAGER AND TO MAKE INVESTMENTS ON BEHALF OF THE FUND.

Initiated By: STATE OF CALIFORNIA: BUSINESS, CONSUMER SERVICES AND HOUSING AGENCY - DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT
Other Sanctions: THE COVER LETTER TO THE ORDER SUMMARILY REVOKING EXEMPT STATUS INDICATED THAT ALL INVESTMENT ADVISORY ACTIVITIES IN CALIFORNIA MUST BE STOPPED.  HOWEVER, THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT INDICATED BY PHONE THAT THE ONLY ACTION REQUIRED WAS TO PAY THE PAST DUE FEE OF $125 THROUGH SUBMISSION OF A NEW INITIAL REPORT AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER WITH CALIFORNIA THROUGH IARD.
Allegations: THE CALIFORNIA EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER STATUS OF OMEGA GLOBAL INVESTORS PTY LTD WAS SUMMARILY REVOKED FOR NON-PAYMENT OF THE RENEWAL FEES ($125) REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER STATUS IN CALIFORNIA.
Resolution Date Explanation: WHILE THE REVOCATION WAS AUTOMATIC AND SUMMARY, THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT INDICATED BY PHONE THAT EXEMPT REPORTING STATUS WOULD BE REINSTATED WITHOUT PENALTY UPON PAYMENT OF THE PAST DUE $125 FEE THROUGH SUBMISSION OF A NEW INITIAL REPORT AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER WITH CALIFORNIA THROUGH IARD.  SUCH SUBMISSION, ALONG WITH PAYMENT OF SUCH FEE, IS EXPECTED TO BE MADE ON OR ABOUT MARCH 30, 2015.
Sanction Detail: THE ORDER INDICATED THAT EXEMPT REPORTING STATUS WAS SUMMARILY REVOKED.  WHILE THE COVER LETTER TO THE ORDER INDICATED THAT INVESTMENT ADVISORY ACTIVITIES MUST BE STOPPED, THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT INDICATED BY PHONE THAT THE ONLY ACTION REQUIRED WAS TO PAY THE $125 FEE THROUGH SUBMISSION OF A NEW INITIAL REPORT AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER WITH CALIFORNIA THROUGH IARD.  NO FINES, PENALTIES OR OTHER SANCTIONS WERE IMPOSED.
Summary: OMEGA GLOBAL INVESTORS PTY LTD UNINTENTIONALLY FAILED TO PAY A $125 ANNUAL RENEWAL FEE DUE IN CONNECTION WITH ITS EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER STATUS IN CALIFORNIA, AND AS A RESULT, ON FEBRUARY 6, 2015, THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT SUMMARILY REVOKED ITS STATUS AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER IN CALIFORNIA.  THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT INDICATED BY PHONE THAT THE ONLY ACTION REQUIRED TO REMEDY THIS REVOCATION WAS TO PAY THE PAST DUE FEE OF $125 THROUGH SUBMISSION OF A NEW INITIAL REPORT AS AN EXEMPT REPORTING ADVISER WITH CALIFORNIA THROUGH IARD.  OMEGA GLOBAL INVESTORS PTY LTD INTENDS TO MAKE SUCH SUBMISSION AND PAY SUCH FEE ON OR ABOUT MARCH 30, 2015.

Initiated By: CHICAGO MERCANTILE EXCHANGE
Other Sanctions: 5 BUSINESS DAY SUSPENSION OF KAMAL KASERA'S INDIRECT AND DIRECT ACCESS TO ELECTRONIC TRADING AND CLEARING PLATFORMS OWNED OR CONTROLLED BY CME GROUP.
Allegations: ON JUNE 20 AND 28, 2011, KAMAL KASERA ENGAGED IN A SERIES OF ROUND-TURN TRANSACTIONS ON THE CME GLOBEX ELECTRONIC TRADING PLATFORM WHICH RESULTED IN THE TRANSFERRING OF EQUITY BETWEEN ACCOUNTS. IN COMMITTING THESE ACTIONS, KASERA VIOLATED CBOT RULE 432.G.
Sanction Detail: SUSPENDED ON APRIL 26, 29, 30, MAY 1, 2, 2013 (5 BUSINESS DAYS) FROM INDIRECT AND DIRECT ACCESS TO ALL ELECTRONIC TRADING AND CLEARING PLATFORMS OWNED OR CONTROLED BY CME GROUP.
Summary: ON APRIL 24, 2013 KAMAL KASERA SUBMITTED AN OFFER OF SETTLEMENT TO THE CHICAGO BOARD OF TRADE BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEE. ON APRIL 24, 2013, KASERA PRESENTED THE SETTLEMENT OFFER TO A PANEL OF THE BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEE, WHICH WAS SUPPORTED BY THE MARKET REGULATION DEPARTMENT. THE BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEE PANEL ACCEPTED THE SETTLEMENT OFFER. THE DECISION BECAME FINAL ON APRIL 24, 2013 AND BECAME EFFECTIVE ON APRIL 26, 2013.

Initiated By: STATE OF CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT
Allegations: STATE OF CALIFORNIA REVOKED EXEMPT STATUS FOR INVESTMENT ADVISOR BECAUSE ALLEGES $125.00 FEE WAS NOT PAID FOR THE YEAR - APPEALING BASED ON MISTAKE
Resolution Date Explanation: STILL WAITING FOR INFORMATION BACK FROM STATE OF CALIFORNIA REGARDING REMEDYING.
Summary: STATE OF CALIFORNIA ALLEGES $125 REGISTRATION FEE WAS NOT PAID.  INVESTMENT ADVISOR DOES NOT BELIEVE THIS IS THE CASE, HOWEVER, WORKING WITH STATE OF CA TO REMEDY (AND WILL PAY IF NEED BE).
